So much of greenery all around. Rooms are big and well maintained. Bathrooms are neat and clean. Food is excellent. The only reason this resort will run for a long time is because of the staff. The smiling face of every staff member is such a pleasant sight, never heard a 'no' from any one of them for any of our requests.Hats off to Mr. Tulsiram and Mr. Rajesh for their hospitality, who gave us a holiday full of memories.

Dindi- the place with lots of greenery and a beautiful resort..that is by the sterling resorts. I love the resort...the theme of construction in dindi was lovely look we had at our first sight.i felt in love with resort by the first sight of my visit.Reception desk people were good and helpful.Rooms were spacious and clean with a balcony of every room.And every evening they held nice entertainment in the action vity room..lastly nice disco we did.Actually we went with lot of members..we enjoyed thoroughly. Swimming pool is nice and clean...they always clean time to time.Coming to the food...it was amazing taste of konaseema food.Lots of varieties... And putharekulu I love it... I can say...everyone feel a pleasant stay with this resort at dindi..am sure...

A unique property by the Godavari river in a natural setting. The service is generally good but a bit slow. The restaurant food is generally good. The restaurant manager and the head chef were courteous and asked us about the kind of food we like and made the dishes to our liking - especially my parents.The resort is relatively new and the service staff have some learning to do. Not yet of quality you find at any Kerala resort - but given the location the resort can become a top destination in Konaseema area. We hope to visit again when it is not so hot and hope to give it an overall rating of 5!. A morning walk on the bridge is very relaxing.

I had gone to Dindi during the first week of Feb along with my spouse to celebrate our anniversary. At the onset I was skeptical however I took my chances after looking at the pictures and I am glad to state that they did not disappoint me. Infact, it was the first time that I saw a resort which was exactly the way it looked in the pictures online.Since it was only 500 kms from Hyderabad, we chose to drive down. I stayed there for 3 nights and had some of the best authentic Andhra food which was specially selected for us by the Restaurant Manager Mr.Rajesh. He also went a step ahead and got some dishes prepared for us which were not part of the standard menu.The resort was spick and span and had spacious rooms with excellent house keeping facilities. The balcony of our room opened towards the Lotus Pond. Resort Manager Mr.Tulsiram was a perfect host. When he got to know about the occasion that we were celebrating, he was kind enough to decorate our room with flowers, towels and balloons, he also sent us a cake which was very kind of him.We did a local village tour early in the morning and that was a great experience as well, We had fresh coconut water, the coconuts were plucked from the tree in front of us.All in all I would definitely recommend this place for a good break from the hectic city life.Once again thank you to the resort team for making our stay special and memorable.Cheers!Bharat

3 of us (colleagues) with our families had been to Dindi in the first week November 2015. After 660 KMs drive we landed to this lovely place. Approach roads are okay but donot take the left turn immediately after the Godavari bridge, instead go further down by about 500 meters or so and take the cone left turn.We reached here in the evening and were like where did we land up. Moved in, easy checkins. We had taken 4 rooms right at the spiral stairs. This place is just simply awesome. The rooms are clean. Has a nice living, kitchen area, dining table/chairs, a bedroom with a lovely balcony (view is simply awesome). You can see Godavari river from here and the greens.Now let me tell you one thing. Lilly. The entire resort is beautifully built around a pond of lillys. Different types of them. They even have Amazonas lilly. We found a few of them clicking which could even hold a new born baby. Its a teeat for the eyes, be it when you wake up, walk to the restaurant, get in get out, or just simply sit there and keep watching. We stayed here for 3 nights. I wish to come here for atleast a week. My mom, daughter and my wife all loved this place. Now about the resort management. They are simply too good. I firgot the restaurant manager's name. But he took care very small little thing you can think of. Food be it ala carte or the buffet were tasty. They even went out of way to get us something that was not in the buffet. You dont find restaurants like that too often. Breakfast by the lillys were nice.When we were leaving we did not have the heart and wished we stayed longer.A great getaway that you should not miss :)

The resort is in a beautiful location of Konaseema. The lush green trees, the lotus ponds, the beauty of nature is everywhere.The rooms are very generous. Very friendly staff and the food is fantastic. We are NRIs who moved overseas 25 years back. I was very proud to show my birth place to my daughter and son in law the way I enjoyed when I was young.A sincere suggestion to the Management:- Please maintain this beautiful resort regularly and continuously. That way we can bring more guests from abroad and show our great country and your excellent hospitality.

We had spent one night and two days at Sterling Resorts at Dindi by Godavari. It is a great place to spend a few days. Absolute tranquility, serene natural beauty ,green and green every where. The resort is well kept,clean,neat and with many lakes filled with different varieties of lotus plants and flowers. The staff at the resort are very courteous right from reception through to your room. Rooms are well kept with all accessories like coffee and tea kettle , micro Owen and with good a/c.Good restaurant and the staff is helpful. Food is good. We enjoyed our stay and would like to go again with some friends this time. Y. K. Rao

Perfect escape from daily routine .....A place to relish lush green coconut grooves....bond with family. Be with nature by bank of Godavari. Took around 90 minutes to reach from Rajmundry station other option is to take taxi from bheemavaram (40 minutes ).Well depends on the train you take . Property has been developed keeping flora and founa in mind.... you will be welcomed by lotus flowers blooming to the glory in the pond surrounded by rooms.Rooms are maintained pretty well .....nothing to complain . In house restaurant serves all cuisine and staff is happy to accommodate if you have any special request. .........very quick service . Not much of sight seeing except boat ride in godavary but you may want to visit few famous temples around ......or just eat sleep enjoy nature and relax

Among all the Sterling resorts in South India ( of course we have not been to Sterling resorts in Goa yet) the 'Dindi-By The Godavari' is a jewel in the crown! The resort is extremely beautiful. It has big and well furnished clean rooms with fairly big balconies providing good views, modern bathrooms, cool lighting, good ac etc.for a comfortable stay. Serene atmosphere to calm our mind. Clean air for the lungs.Beautiful ponds with lilies, lotuses and coconut trees,beautifully illuminated - a feast for the eyes. Coconut grove in a vast area - to walk around. A clean and well maintained swimming pool - to soak up. A well designed vishranti mantap with swings and benches close to the majestic Godavari river-to laze away. A few indoor and outdoor games - to keep active. A good restaurant. Add to these helpful and friendly staff. The resort is picture perfect - ideal place for people who want to relax.The restaurant menu should include Andhra specials. Cost could be reduced. There is no library. Hence carry your own books that you wanted to read but couldn't find time. You can bask near the pool with a book in hand.We (wife, son and self) holidayed during end Feb. and enjoyed every moment of our stay. Thanks to Mr.Tulsiram,GM, Mr,Prithviraj,Manager, and all other staff for making our holiday a memorable one.

I stayed for 2 days in both the premier and the classic room. There is not much of a difference between the two. Choose classic room as it is cheaper by 1000 bucks. The rooms, the linen and bathrooms are clean and comfortable. The property is well maintained and has a pond which gives the resort a great look. The food is average as some of the dishes are good while the others are pretty average. There are limited options. The complimentary breakfast was good. Below are a few pointers:1. Food: Opt for handi biriyani, dum aloo. Rotis are not great thus we had to eat kulchas (they are good but made of maida so not a preferred choice). Pasta is on menu but was not available except for spaghheti.2. Property and amenities: Good. It has a decent pool, volleyball space, table tennis, game room which is great (It has carroms, taboo etc.) and activities room which can be used to dance on self selected music. It has cycles also available which need to be rented to ride on them.3. Connectivity: Wifi is only available in lobby. It should be made available in rooms too. So not happy with wifi as it is a must these days.Overall happy with my stay. You can go to nearby APTDC property for boat ride on Godavari.

We were at the resort from Feb 25th to 28th. We were a family of 6 including senior citizens. We were first impressed by the ambience of the Hotel which is built on a Lotus Pond. It has a unique Central Lotus Pond area with special lighting at night. We were pleasantly surprised that there were no mosquitoes because of the water bodies.It has a selection of river view Rooms. The first floor rooms on all sides offer a better view outside the windows.the Hotel has a good Mix of Activities including Swimming Pool and Sports. The SPA is worth visiting. Boating on River Godavari is available in the Govt. Resort located next Door.The Food is above average and also includes local popular Dishes. The service is good. Weekends are crowded. Weekdays are best for quite relaxation.The sightseeing options include a visit to Antarvedi the sangam where Godavari meets the sea.All the staff including Mr Tulsiram, MrPrithviraj and Rajesh took good care of us.We enjoyed our stay and hope to return in the future.

Our stay at Dindi,By the Godavari was excellent. This was an option we chose at the last moment by just viewing the lovely resort with the lotus pond but were very happy to have chosen to it. We were totally bowled by the kind hospitality & service by the ever smiling staff , the food was very good & we got to taste the culinary delights of the area. This place totally relaxes you & the spa services (massages) rejuvenated all of us.we would highly recommend this resort where the serene Godavari soothes ur nerves. thanks to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

I and my wife visited the Dindi resort of Sterling this week. A very quite place in the middle of a man made pond full of lotus flowers of different colors very close to Godavari river. Rooms were very neat, spacious and comfortable. Great staff and their hospitality was superb. The resort Manager Mr. Prithviraj is a very nice person who tries to make your stay extremely comfortable. The restaurant manager Mr. Rajesh was outstanding and personally took care of the requirements of the guests. Food items in the menu card appear limited but if you want something specific Mr. Rajesh tries his best to get you the same. Rest of the staff were also very polite and helpful. We traveled by train from Chennai to Rajahmundry from where it takes around 2 hours to reach the location. We hired a car for 4 days from RV Tours, Rajahmundry for local sightseeing since this is much cheaper. The driver from RV Tours was again very helpful and took us to all important temples. There are not many attractions near the resort other than many temples including the famous Narasimha Swamy temple at Antarvedi and Someswara Swamy temple in Bhimavaram. Any visit must be planned between October to early March since the weather can really get very hot during summer when it may be difficult to venture out. This is a sort of a remote location and it is better to carry essential medicines with you when you visit their resort. During the past few years Sterling has improved its facilities in all its locations and Dindi despite being functional only for past 9 months is another feather in the cap of Sterling. I would certainly visit this once again.

Dindi sterling resort in built with lotous ponds,very nice view.surrounded by cocunut trees.river godavari flowing one side.really its very good location.resort fully neat and clean.and food is very good.hotel manager tulsiram and rakesh resturent manager and other staffs personally takes care for every guests.nearby antravelly narshima temple is very famous near godavari river and sea sangam.one can watch river and sea in the same place.its between narshapur and palakulu.rajamundri airport is just 70 km.resorts swimming pool just over viewing the godavari river.one can also do boating in river.from Hyderabad by train narsapur express starts at 9.45 pm and reach palakulu at 7.50am.and resort is just 15 km from that.one can go up to narsapur also and from there the resort is just 17 km.by road from Hyderabad one can reach dindi in 8 hours.one must visit the place and enjoy the view and hospitality of the resort staff specially of tulsiram manager of resort and Rajesh resturent manager who serve very deligious foods as per guest choices.

The resort is beautiful architecturally and the sensitivity to local environment deserves praise. The food is deliciously authentic Andhra cuisine, along with a range of Indian/continental options, although we feasted exclusively on the local delicacies. The staff at the restaurant took great care of us. The resort manager Mr Thulsiram was relentlessly thoughtful and paid attention to every detail to ensure impeccable quality and service. The manager of housekeeping did a stellar job to keep the room clean and well stocked with the basics of water, fruits and bath supplies. The welcome drink of buttermilk was fantastic, as were the daily supply of Rasthikeli bananas and oranges. We were a family of 3 couples and 3 children and traveled from Chennai for the first time to Dindi. We arrived a couple of days before Christmas and stayed for 4 days and the team made my daughter's 6th birthday a very special occasion! My children have now become big fans of the Bottabomulus, which are giant dolls from the region and were a feature of the christmas eve celebrations. Look forward to many more vacations at this resort in the care of Mr Thulsiram and with Sterling

I wen on Vacation with my family to Dindi - By the Godavari resort (from 29-12-15 to 02-01-16) for 4 nights. I would say my overall experience was pathetic to say the least. Here are few of my observations/feedback:I spoke to some of the other guests who were non-members and came to know that they were staying in privileged rooms (which were supposed to be given to members), but where as I was put into a guest room saying no studio rooms were available. I really don't know how can you make your member stay in a guest room and make the non-members stay in a privileged studio rooms.The buffet menu provided was very ordinary and routine with absolutely no variety, it was very boring to eat the same kind of stuff for 4 days. Restaurant staff was never helpful and they absolutely have no training on how to interact with guests, especially this guy Mithun should be told and seriously trained on how to be polite and interact with guests. Mr Rajesh who is the restaurant in charge should be told by someone to treat all his guests equally and that there shouldn't be any partiality towards certain guests. I find him to be ridiculous!We have no option in Dindi resort to book a private cab, so we have to go with what ever is provided to us by Sterling resorts. You guys charge 15 Rs per KM plus taxes which is a very high rate. I don't think anyone in the country charges this kind of price per KM. When I checked with the cab driver they too agreed that 15 Rs per KM was very high. Private cab guy charged us 350 Rs for a drop from Palakollu railway station to Sterling resorts which is 15 KMs, but sterling is charging us 950 Rs for the same drop :)New year eve celebration was again a open loot from the members where we ended up paying 4500 for 3 of us which included my 7 years old daughter. This price can get you into some of the best new year eve celebrations in Hyderabad. First of all why should we pay for new year eve celebrations is it not the resorts responsibility to take care of that or at least for the members? Funny thing is we ended up paying this huge amount but still we couldn't get bottle of drinking water as even that is an extra chargeWe weren't provided with any complimentary soaps, shampoo, shaving kit, tooth paste or tooth brush during our stay. None of the staff members were pleasing to talk with and none of them were trained to be pleasing. We have to literally chase the restaurant staff to take our order and sometimes I felt it would be better to have your food sitting in your room than that restaurant. I tried to reach the resort manager to give my feedback on all these, but Mr Manager was never reachable. To be frank I don't even know the name of the resort manager and doesn't even know how he looks like. I would not recommend any of my friends for Dindi sterling resort and I would never ever visit that place even if I'm given a all inclusive free stay.

It is just a perfect property, a dream property in all aspects. Its asthetic appeal, over all interiors, restaurant ambience, beautiful pond, river nearby, large open spaces, holiday activities for kids, all in all a very well balanced hotel. Its fun to experience a well maintained Swimming Pool and all other exterior game areas. Well discipline n helping approach of Staff raises the bar of feel good factor. A must visit for a short vacation...Overall the Resort Manager insured our vacation for funfilled holiday....hope to revisit soon

Property is very goodWelcoming/send off was not so great.Rooms are goodRequest to ask for studio type rooms so that its quite big and they have very good facing of Lilly pond viewPlace is neat and cleanFood is good, Good hospitality from Manager Rajesh. Whatever he requested he could make it for us.Event manager was also good conducted good program during Diwali.It’s just 6 months old property so would suggest team to keep the same work and improve as per the guest feedback will help them.ConsBuffet price is very high and we don’t see value for money as they don’t have much variety if we are expecting.Need to improve quality on Desserts as they are not up to the standard.Over all front office and Room service can be improved little as they are new I am agree but its not the benchmark.Overall I am happy with the stay 4/5One more attraction is : Next to the property is the Andhra Pradesh tourism guest house where you can walk to the property and you can utilize few additional service like Boating and few adventure activity..kids zone. Going directly and take a boat ride is cheaper than going via sterling.

Stayed with Family in this resort during the last week ( 3 days 2 nights ) ; the resort is very well maintained and kept clean . the Check in was quick and we started enjoying at the word go . The Resort Manager Mr Tulasiram adds another Star to the experience and i have heard this from every other guest during our stay .. There is no "NO" in his vocabulary - he will do everything in his capacity to honor any genuine request .. Overall a peaceful and nice place to stay with family or friends for a couple of days .. For families - its very secured and you have a good mix of the menu for kids and adults . Only one down side which could be improved is the cramped parking - but it easily fits 10 + cars .

An amazing resort to be visited for its peaceful room views, serene lotus pond ( looks the best at night ), great food, thrilling activities and a good get away from the routine life .U feel close to nature like never before !and also enjoy the Godavari just 'by ur side'. ;)Best place to be with families , friends and guaranteed fun for all age groups !We would love to visit the resort again..no doubt :)thnx to the whole team of DINDI RESORTS for their great hospitality and a special thnq to Mr. Tulsiram and Mr. Prithviraj for their amazing care :)TO BE VISITED MORE THAN ONCE :)

The concept of this place is to get in touch with nature in the most simple way- Take a holiday by the side of River and you shall feel the difference immediately. The place is designed like a village with the earthy feel and touch to its entire building. The rooms are spacious , courteous staff and lip-smacking food at their restaurant. Strolling across their garden overlooking the River, with the pool nearby. They have games and other activities on weekends. Though they say that you can have a room with the river view from balcony, none of their rooms overlook the river. other than that the overall holiday experience was very relaxing and rejuvenating. The staff is very helpful, if you wanna get something special done you can count on them. I had a special candle light dinner setup by the river side during my stay (its chargeable). They do not have Wi-fi service in the rooms, which is good with the kind of holiday they provide. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable.

While planning the trip we noted Dindi By the Godavari as a new resort but still we decided to visit the place just because of name of sterling and we are really glad to tell you that we were not wrong. The interior at dindi sterling resort is absolutely phenomenal specially to mention beautifully cultivated and maintained lotus pond. The Hospitality experienced by the staff members is really humanly the last thing to mention is about our experience of House boat trip by APTDC which is remarkable experience of this trip.

We stayed here for 3 nights. It is located on banks of River Godavari. The rooms are spacious and very clean (Well maintained). The rooms are built around a Lotus pond which gives a picturesque view. The resort and restaurant staff was very cordial and supportive. Food is also excellent. They serve both north and south Indian food. The best part was, they offered the food on our choice apart from the regular buffet. They have lots of entertainment activities for all the age groups. An excellent place to spend time with family and friends.

We stayed at this place for two Days and two Nights recently and would rate this as one of my best vacation place. The surroundings of this resort are Serene and Picturesque and would match that of the Kerala backwater resorts. The Highlight of this Resort is the nice layout of the rooms around the Lotus pond where we could see Lotus in various colors and size bloom. The Pictures shown in the website is what you see there. The rooms are comfortable and large enough to accommodate a family of four. We took a studio room with balcony opening to the Lotus Pond.This resort is newly built and there are few things that are still in making but the overall experience has been very good.The housekeeping staff is good and very prompt.The Restaurant décor is just fine and they could have made it little bit more snazzy when I compare it with other Sterling properties.The food is really good and I enquired if we could get a local cuisine for dinner and I was thrilled to relish among the best South Indian fare by a local Chef. The bar has not started yet and might start once they get the license.The location of the swimming pool is just adjacent to the River Godavari and the Evening looks scintillating with the sunset shining over the river.The landscape around pool is mostly completed and addition of few kids outdoor rides (swing, slides etc) and hammock will be awesome.Special thanks to Mr Tulsiram who is the Resort Manager for personally taking feedbacks from every guests to make sure that everyone is having the best of experiences during their stay at Resort.One could also take Boat rides and other water sport activities from the APTDC resort just adjacent to the sterling resorts.

Dear friends,I recently visited Streling's Dindi-by the Godavari resort.It was rejuvenating to see nature at it's truest here.I had only read about these lily pads which can hold babies weighing upto 8 kgs but to see them here in India was a fascinating experience.The homely and simple yet scrumptious food served by the hospitable F&B crew touched my heart.Being a senior citizen, such old world values were truly appealing.The General Manager Mr.Tulsiram pays great attention to the housekeeping and comfort aspects for all the guests.One of the best Sterling resorts I have been to...kudos to the whole team...It is a must-visit resort!

... that they take customers for granted. But its kind of expected if you factor in fact that is pioneer of 'time sharing' hotel concept in india - and that means customer has already paid upfront for hundreds of nights. Anyway I wasn't a member but their attitude carries over to 'walk-in' customers as well. We arrived 9am and by the time we had breakfast it was just 2 hours until checkin. They charged Rs1500 for just 2 hours. Our infant was acting up due to tiring journey so we had to grudgingly accept. The hotel was so unoccupied at that time that they even canceled breakfast buffet. I avoided this unreasonably high charge on checkout by booking another night at discounted trip via online discount code I had, and checked out after 5 hours of use. One trick they try to play is to tell the actual charges or availability at last hour. They'll never tell you both. That happened both at checkin as well as checkout and again when asked them to arrange for a cab for drop to station. I had to keep insisting as they were refusing to confirm availability of car till 1 hour before journey. Finally I made alternative arrangements using aptdc resort that is next door. Same goes for their tours to Antarvedi. I would recommend to contact aptdc next door. Resort is quite small. After pond there is little landscape. Godavri flows adjacent but there is no effort made to allow guests to enjoy is beauty. Not even few benches, close to view. You are expected to just walk over to the resort fence look over it. But rooms are spacious and comfortable. Food is average and terribly expensive - for a couple and infant it came to 3000+ for 4 meals, over a day and a half. Nothing fancy ordered.

I think this is one the best resort from Sterling, amazing location, on the banks of Godvari river.I went with the group of 24 pax and after reaching the resort we were like WOW what a resort it is! Rooms were well furnished and well maintained and it was built around lotus pond and i can say all rooms were of 5 star standards.Food was unbelievable, we took breakfast & lunch package in which they served all varieties of food from, north indian, south indian and italian, whatever food they served was great. chef was also very kind enough to ask if at all we wanted any special variety, twice he made some special snacks for us.I would love to visit it again because of nice hospitality given by hotel staff and i would specially want thank Mr. Rajesh - F&B manager who was always helpful to us.

Myself and my wife stayed at this resort of sterling from 01 September to 05th September. The location is very nice and looks like Kerala in plains. Lots of coconut trees and Godavari was full of water due to recent rains.Total staff at this resort are very cooperative and made the stay enjoyable.Especially the restaurant food and Beverage manager Mr. Rajesh and chef Mr Suman took special care in advising the food recipe to order and explained the how they are making the recipe. The restaurant menu offer selection of food with local flavor and other common south and north Indian recipes.This location is only for relaxation, as there is no other nearby places to explore except some places of religious importance.There was no internet connectivity in the rooms. Wifi is available only in receptions and that is also of poor connectivity.

We were stunned by the beauty of the resort. The rooms are built around a lovely lotus/lily pond. Some rooms face the backwaters of the Godavari river. The rooms and bathrooms are luxurious and well appointed, 5 star standards.The restaurant overlooks the lily pond. There is a wide range of cuisine available. The buffet had a very good spread. The food was consistently delicious. They offer certain packages which minimises the cost of dining. The restaurant staff was exceptionally efficient, helpful and friendly, especially the F &B manager, Mr Rajesh. There is a swimming pool, facilities for games and entertainment is organised in the evenings. One can go for a boat ride on the Godavari by booking with the Tourism guest house next door.Sterling resorts Dindi by the Godavari is a wonderful place to stay.

This was a good resorts besides river godawari.surrounded by coconut trees,full of greenary and lotous flower pond.the rooms built is such a way middle is lotous pond surrouned by rooms. very nice view.resorts staff are very coporatives,food is very good.every body enjoy the food.spceial fish for non veg persons.the resort have a nice swiming pool with nice soft water.near by boating service by a p tourisam is avail able at gidawari river.near 23 km godawari river joined the sea.so visitors can enjoy river in one side and sea on other side.some famous temples are within 40 km ranges.one can enjoy the place.staying plus good hospitality by hotel staff and good food and good view with trees and ponds is very good.swiming pool aceing godawari river is great attraction.see the river and sea sangam and enjoy river and sea same place.from hyderabad narsapur express available which start at 10 pm and reach palakullu station at 8 am.on return journy train start at 7 pm and reach hyderabad at 5 pm.

We went as a group of 7 families with kids to this newest offering by Sterling Resorts, true to the photographs on the website, this resort is located amidst lush greenery and on the banks of the magnificent Godavari, which was in itself breathtaking.Pros: Food, Excellent upkeep of property, clean and tidy rooms, Lush scenery all around.Cons: Short of staff, when there are more than one group accommodated in the resort, there are not enough hands to attend to the guests, teething troubles as this is a new resort in itself. The property does not have a licence to server liquor yet, however, the bar area was impressive :-)

We stayed in this property for 1st and 2nd of Sept. This property is adjacent to AP Tourism Dindi Resort. In fact, my colleague had stayed at AP Tourism property which I believe is a decent one. However I chose this one as it had good rankings in Tripadvisor. I made the booking through "Booking.com". My credit card was charged on 31st Aug and still was made to pay again by the property citing non-payment from booking.com. Now having paid twice for the room, I am now trying to get back money from the property. Coming back to Property, this is in Dindi village which is surrounded by coconut trees and branches of Godavari. It is near to Palakollu (take deviation from Tanuku on NH towards Rajahmundry). The best part is the drive. Property is very nice given that it is new and maintained well however service needs great improvement. Housekeeping staff is good but restaurant staff is laidback. Only exceptions being Mohibul and Minto who extended good hospitality and took good care. We didn't try food but for the breakfast which was above average.Overall, a lovely property in Konaseema. You will love the lotus blooms.

I went with my parents to this resort, it was indeed a very relaxing atmosphere.I went during the week days, hence the occupancy was very less. Therefore there were no holiday activities or buffet during the week days. Go there only for the weekend and stay not more than 2 days, or else you get bored really quickly. Nothing much to do outside the resort. Food provided in the restaurant is just Average and you dont have any options of eating out. The service is really good, and the resort in an overall aspect is good. Please keep enough money in cash to pay your resort bills, because the card swiping machine has a vodaphone connection and vodaphone is the only network provided which do not work in this resort.

We were 3 couples with kids who'd travel to Sterling Resort in Dindi...Had a wonderful moment while we were their...First thing we did was jump in the pool to cool off from the day long journey....Kids had a blast...We enjoyed playing ZINGA in the play room...and had a blast during the independence day party...The moment you enter the resort you are mesmerized by a beautiful lake filled with lotuses...The rooms are also good...but the food is awful... had a few varieties of indiancuisine...but the taste is not at all good...need to change their chef...

Superb Resort.. Great facility.. and AWESOME food.. We went there for 3 nights and wanted a competely chilled and relaxing holiday - and this was THE answer to that.Thoroughly enjoyed the room.. services.. and all the ala carte foood that we ordered - were REALLY Yum. The buffet is a bit limited - but I would not complain.The outdoor pool surrounded by the coconut trees was where we spent most of our time... and the lily pond around which the resort is built was our morning view.Not raising too high hopes - I would say this is a 3 star property but with great service.. new rooms.. good attention by the staff.. and descent enough activities at the resort.This is right next to the APTDC Harita resort - from where you can do some water sports- its hardly 50 -100 mts away.Would DEFENITELY recommend it for a good weekend getaway from Hyderabad. Would defenitely want to go back to this place.

Eleven of us travelled to the new Sterling Resort Dindi By Godavari from Hyderabad and were there for two nights from 31st July to 2nd August 2015. All the facilities were amazing at the Resort.. the Rooms, the Food, the ambience, the indoor and outdoor facilities..in particular the amazing scene of the Godavari flowing behind the Property.Special mention needs to be made about the smiling faces which greet you at every moment we cross them and the wonderful delicious food that was being served at the Cafeteria.A Great Location with Great Warm Hearts which welcome you and serve you during the Stay.Dindi By Godavari - Will come again for yet another relaxed stay.

This property is a new addition to Sterling group. It is located on the banks of the river Godavari in a village named Dindi - which almost 3 hours drive from Vijayawada/ two hours from Rajahmundry. The entire stretch stretch is scenic, with lots of greenery. The resort is located next to AP tourism property. Its a beautiful place built over a Lily pond. All Rooms open to the lily pond, either from the main door or from the balcony.Rooms are very spacious, and well maintained. There are frequent power cuts in the locality, due to the remote location. However the staff do a good job in maintaining the generators and limit the power cut duration to a greater extent.The backyard of the property is maintained well. There are a lot of coconut tress. There are earmarked places for some outdoor activities. The swimming pool is situated at the corner of the property facing the river. The entire landscape as well as the swimming pool is maintained really well. the quality of water in the pool is appreciable.Front desk were very cordial during the reception. Though we had reached very early than the check in time, we were accomodated immediately. Thanks to Teja.Coming to the food, there are very less options to eat out, so we pretty much had all our three meal during our four night stay in the resort. The quality of food was outstanding. Though they had a limited menu, due to the nonavailability of certain ingredients in that region, they made sure the taste and quality is perfect. Special credit to Rajesh - F&B Manager, who made sure that we were taken care with the right type of food. His cool approach and ability to suggest various food varieties is commendable.The room service was timely. Special thanks to Ravi, Mohibul, to name a few.The resort doesn't have a license to operate a bar. However, liquor could be purchased from AP Tourism resort or at few shops in the village.The areas of improvement suggested would be the expertise on the local region and the wifi connectivity, (if something could be done about it). Many of the staff are new, though they took efforts to give us suggestions on the place to visit etc...yet google maps was able to provide us with more info in many instances. i guess this is just a teething issue, which they would over come in the coming months.Over all we had a great time at Dindi, and would surely add this to our yearly tour map. Place worth visiting.Note: Vodafone doesn't at most of the places in the resort.

If you're looking for a quick dash close to Hyderabad, then Dindi By The Godavari is just right. It is overnight by train from Hyderabad (take train to Palakollu station which is 15 kms from the Resort), and return through the same mode.Dindi By The Godavari is a new property by Sterling Group and is on the banks of the river Godavari (as the name suggests), with rooms set around a lily pond, and the swimming pool near the banks. It has the pre-requisite abundant coconut trees in and around the property giving the perfect tropical feel.The rooms, dining arrangements are all standard and good, no reason to complain. The food is nice and the best part is their staff. All are very hospitable and warm, genuinely interested to know your requirements and to do their best to fulfill them.If you're looking for a quiet time, do try to visit on a week day as apparently they are full on weekends! We were a group of 14 adults who had the perfect time on Friday, but Saturday saw another group of 105 come in! The resort is perfect to go with friends, family and has a swimming pool, a games room (with lots of games to play), outdoor games (but it is black cotton soil area so if it rains, don't expect to be playing outdoors), etc.We had a wonderful two days at the resort, and recommend it to everyone!

The location of the hotel was very good. The appearance of the hotel was good. I had booked this hotel by online booking. There was no delay in check in and checkout. The booking and front office was good in the hotel. The room was very good in the hotel. All amenities were available in good condition in the room. The behaviour of staff’s was good in the hotel. The food was average in the hotel. I had paid separate payment for food. The activities were not arranged by the hotel. I had visited this hotel with my family. I would suggest this hotel to improve the food quality. The hotel was located nearby the bus stop. I would recommend this hotel for upcoming travellers. I went to this hotel by my own vehicle.

The hotel was not difficult to locate. The hotel was about 2 kms away from the railway station and the bus stand. The staffs in the hotel were helpful. They were quick in attending all my requests. The hotel was under renovation at that time. The hotel was not according to the money they charged me. The room given to me was average and well maintained. All the amenities were working properly in the room. Hill view could be seen from my room. Hot water facility was provided for 24 hours. The bathroom was neat and clean. I had tasted the food from the hotel. The food served in the hotel was not good in quality and also costly. The hotel had not provided any kind of activities. I had visited the hotel with family. It was a recommendable hotel.

The location of the hotel was near to the railway station. The building of the hotel was newly renovated. The interior and exterior of the hotel was well decorated. The ambiance at the hotel was clean and tidy. The behaviour of the staff was kind. The check in and checkout process was not delayed. The room given to me was comfortable and the bathroom was hygienic. All amenities in the room were worked well. The hot and cold water facility was provided by the hotel. The laundry service was there at the hotel. The bed sheets and pillows were kept neat and cleaned. I didn’t see any view from my room. The food which they served to me was delicious and the price was reasonable. The quality and quantity of food was better. The activities like swimming pool, gym, spa, etc. were organized by the hotel. The hotel had not conducted any sightseeing trip. I would like to visit this hotel again. I would like to recommend this hotel for other travellers. Overall appearance of the hotel was excellent.

I travelled to Manali from 2nd - 5th Jan to celebrate new year with friends and family. We have chosen White Mist - Sterling resorts from makemytrip. Since the deal was good so we thought to opt the same. By the time we reached Manali we have called the service desk to ask whether they provide cab for the hotel which they clearly denied. We took a private cab from bus stand to the hotel which is placed around 5 km from it. After reaching the hotel we requested to see the room but they asked us to wait for 30 mins since the room was not cleaned. By the time we wish to see the hotel, we came to know that the hotel was quite different as shown in the pictures. Certain cons which I would like to highlight:

1. The hotel as mentioned on site is not on Mall Road but far away from it, around 5 km.

2. Transportation costs around Rs. 200 per side if you wish to go to Mall Road or nearby.

3. Hotel mentions 80 rooms but have only 33 rooms instead.

4. There is no facility of Wi-fi as mentioned on websites.

5. The staff was not at all helpful in sorting out your queries.

6. No generator facility at the night in case of breakdown.

7. It seems to be more than a 3 star hotel rather than a resort.

8. No good restaurants nearby. Only option is to have it in hotel only.

9. They don't even provide a knife to cut fruits or rather you can say they don't even show courtesy even to facilitate you.

10. Room cleaning can be done only once and that too as per not your convenience but the time they felt like.

Overall, a disappointing hotel with a scarcity of many facilities.

Hotel was located in a convenient place and it was middle of the city. There was many shopping place near to this hotel. The staff were very good and they friendly, quick to attend us. The appearance of the hotel was good and I was happy with the room allotted for me. The room was specious, neat, clean and well-maintained with all the working amenities. We had a snowfall Mountain View from the room. Hot water facility is available only on time. The food was good in its taste and quality of food was very good but it was expensive. The hoteliers conducted some activities, which was very good.

Staff and service is very good and assist you well. It's located at a good height and near to some famous Manali locations. Room with a good view, reasonably good food, simple breakfast, caring staff, efficient travel desk at a premium. An older type infrastructure less of amenities away from mall road, no WiFi, water heaters could be better do visit for amazing valley views on all sides. It was comfortable stay for the entire family and food was also great.

The hotel is convenient to locate and I did not find any problem in travelling here. I had been here last year and my stay was comfortable. The appearance of the hotel is good and interiors were nice. The staff members were helpful and quick enough in services. The room allotted to me was maintained cleanly with all the required amenities in good condition. The food provided in the hotel was good in quality and taste. There are some activities like yoga and sports games conducted by the management. There was no delay in check-in or check-out procedure. As per my visit the hotel was good and the tariff was worth its services and facilities.

Overall stay was good and as it was convenient to locate. The interior and exterior of the hotel was model. No delay in check-in and check-out. The staff members in the hotel were friendly and quick in services. The room allotted to us was maintained neat with needful amenities, which were working properly. No view from the room. The food in the hotel was average taste but there should be maintained in food quality. There was an activities and sightseeing trip was available.

Sterling Resort is a good place to stay. Although the resort is 2 km away from the main market of Manali but still very approachable. Even in mountain the hotel is having a good parking place and one has not to go steep for parking. The reception and restaurant of the hotel is very nice. The road of Sterling resort also leads to Naggar Castle - which is also a nice place to see. Food quality of the resort is good and moreover the service of the hotel is also quick.

Location is very good for holidays, excellent place to relax. Rooms were excellent, service is good and the staff is very cooperative. Front office makes you feel good on arrival and treat you very nicely. Enjoyed different types of foods and drinks, enjoyed a lot and returned home fresh.

My stay at this hotel was very good and I did not face problem in finding this hotel. The appearance of hotel was maintained well, the staff in hotel was very good, and they were very friendly. There was no any delay in check-in and check-out process. The rooms allotted to us were spacious and well maintained with all basic amenities from the room. The appearance of the hotel was good. The hotelier did not provide any pick up and drop facility. Food was good in its quality and quantity. There were no any activities conducted. I would recommend them to have shaver manual. The money spent to this hotel was worth it and I would recommend this hotel to other travellers.

This hotel is situated just 100m away from Tibetan Monastery and 250m away from Manali bus depot. Hotel location is at good height and near to some famous Manali locations. The rooms are quite spacious and service of the hotel is excellent. Food is amazing and delicious. The hotel staff is good and they assist you well. So it was comfortable stay for me.

I was there in the month of March 2015 and stayed there for 4 days though room and food was good but, the location which is a bit away from the city is the only constraints. You need vehicle every time to go out even for Market or Bus Stop etc. The vehicle can be arranged by the hotel reception or just outside of the hotel one travel agency is there. The area is very peace and rooms are Valley facing, it's wonderful.

The hotel location was good and hotel is located conveniently in the city. The appearance of the hotel was very good and surroundings were maintained good. The room allotted to me was good but it was under renovation so they did not maintained well. There was a mountain view. The food was good with lots of varieties and it was a la carte. There was an activities and it was good as they will display in the board. The staffs were very friendly and good in services. There was no delay during check-in and check-out process. The hotel is worth for the money. I recommend this hotel to other travellers.

I would first like to thanks holidayiq for giving me the platform to share reviews about the Manali - White Mist, A Sterling Holidays Resort, Manali. I had been at this place with my family of 10 members. I am the one who has opted for this hotel. None of my family member ever regret to be in this hotel. The locality of this hotel is near to city. One can really very well, enjoy the snowfall at the balcony of rooms. It's our pleasure to be at this hotel. Manager very well behaved with and thus his staff members. The amenities provided were not so good. But being most of the elder people in our family members, we didn't bother much about it. I truly recommend all to be at this hotel for at least once. Though it was not so expensive. One can really afford it.

We were 4 Families, We stayed there for 3 nights as the manager said there would be a snowfall, we extended from 2 nights to 3 nights. And yes it did Snow. It was beautifully amazing. 

The services provided by the staff and management is no match to any other hotel. The best part is that you get hot boiling water in the shower on demand. The whole resort was well maintained despite there was a renovation going on.

No Compromise on Quality of Service at Sterling Holidays.

Dont Forget to visit Solang Valley.

The hotel is convenient to locate and closer to city. The outlook of the hotel is very good and interiors are maintained very well. The staff members in the hotel are helpful and friendly in behaviour. The room allotted to us spacious and maintained neatly with all the necessary amenities which were working perfectly, and there was snow view available from room. There were no activities or games available or arranged by the hotel management. I had been here with my family and our stay at this hotel was comfortable and money spent was worth it.

We went to honeymoon at Manali and spent at the Sterling Resort. We didn't care about the amenities as we were only concerned about more spending on sightseeing. But overall it was a good experience to stay in the hotel. The servicing was excellent. The staff were very helpful and good matured. The rooms were clean and tidy, and room service was excellent. Only negative point was that most of the items we ordered were not there. Apart from that it was a nice experience.

Travelling in a big group can always be a bit of problem, hence booking in advance always pays off. We were a group of 11 people and had booked this hotel from the online portal.

The place was snow covered and indeed there was white mist all around. The staff was very courteous and helpful. But the hotel was under construction so the vibe was somewhat lacking.

The hotel is situated in somewhat outer parts of Manali, hence is is very peaceful and tranquil. Rooms are expensive and snow covered valley looked very beautiful. Staff was very helpful in making us comfortable. Friendliness of the staff and their help in every little things made us feel very special.

Only problem with this resort is that is is somewhat far from city, therefore stroll back to hotel is not possible, also you may feel some problems from construction side of the hotel. Also I must state that this hotel does not compare to usual standards of Sterling Resorts.

I wouldn't have done anything differently, if I visited there next time. The real stand out here is the staff, which is unmatched and unparalleled.

Visited the hotel for a week of relaxation. The pictures on the website were as experienced by us. The staff was very courteous and helped in all the formalities of checking-in. We were updated everyday of all the activities of the day. The restaurant was clean and the food delicious. The resort keeps renovating their rooms for better ambiance. It was worth a visit.

Travel advisory: Do keep in mind the rush in season that is April to August as there was no space to keep a step and parking in Manali city because of the rush.

Manali White Mist a Sterling holiday Resorts was surrounded by snow covered mountains or peaks on all sides. The resort itself was full of snow during our visit. This resort does total justice to it's name - The white Mist as it is snowy white all around. The service of the team at the resort was excellent. The experience at this resort was a really refreshing one.

I visited Manali and stayed in this hotel with my family for relaxation purpose, and we had a nice experience in this hotel. I did not face any difficulty to reach the hotel as we travelled in our own vehicle and it was conveniently located. The interior and exterior of the hotel was good. The staffs in the hotel were helpful and they gave quick service for our entire request, but the only problem was that they have fixed timing for hot water and apart from that, everything was fine. The room in this hotel was good and maintained well, except geyser all other amenities were provided in working condition. There was a nice mountain view from the hotel room. I had food in the hotel restaurant and it was tasty, the price was reasonable. The check in and checkout process was done on time. There were activates but due to cold we did not utilize it. The hotel was value for money and I will recommend to other travellers.

Manali is a good place with that sterling resort. Resort is nearby city with a good property. There hospitality is nice with good food. Good administration in Manali, no risk at night. Good purchasing spot. Resort is having on best location in Manali, housekeeping is so good. I have good memory there.

Location of the hotel was good.  I faced no problem to find this hotel.  Hotel was located little far from city.  Hotel was located at about 2 kms distance from bus stop.  There was no shopping mall and other points near to the hotel.  No problem during check in and check out facility.  Hotel look wise was okay.  Rooms were neat, clean, and spacious.  24-hour hot water facility was there.  You can see valley view from hotel rooms.  I stayed there for three days.  I took my food outside the hotel but it was little bit costly but I enjoyed my breakfast in the hotel.  All the indoor facilities were there.  Parking facility was there.  I went there in my own car.  It was a family relaxation trip before three years.  Hotel was value for money paid.  I had no suggestion to improve in this hotel.

It was conveniently located and no difficulty to reach the hotel. It is near to the city. Location was good. Room was spacious not so congested. It was neat, clean and well maintained. All the amenities were there in the working condition. There was good view from the room. Food which was served by the hotel was very good and service provided by staff was also very good. No delay during check-in and check-out. Swimming pool, gym and spa was there in the hotel. Sightseeing was also arranged by hotel. I would like to recommend this hotel to others.

The location was very good with good appearance. The staff behaviour was good and helpful. The rooms were good, neat along working amenities  but there was no view. There was no hassles in check in and check out. The food was very tasty, delicious and other activities like swimming pool, badminton also all the indoor games with sight seeing trip facility.

We had little difficulty reaching this resort. Interiors and exteriors were very beautiful. Check-in and check-out was on time. Staff were professional and friendly. Room was spacious, neat, clean and well-maintained with hill view. Food was moderate and less spicy. They provided bonfire at night.

Hotel was good and I did not face any difficulty to find this hotel. Surrounding of the hotel was nice. Inside and outside look of the hotel was fine. Staff behaviour was friendly. I liked the services of this hotel. Room was well-furnished and Mountain View was visible from the room balcony. Staff of the hotel was cleaning the room regularly. I took my food outside the hotel because this food is not suitable for Jain peoples. Booking and front office services were prefect. Furniture and other things were well maintained. I belong from Ahmedabad. Activities were available there DJ, table tennis, etc. I visited there with my family. I can recommend this hotel to other travellers. Money spend there was valuable. As a destination, Manali place is fantastic.

I went there with my family in the month of May. I did book my room through Makemytrip. Location wise, the hotel was located far from the city. Greenery was available in the surrounding of the hotel. behaviour of the staff members was fine and they gave on time services. Room was congested for four members. All basic amenities were functioning properly. AC was not required in the room. Pillow, washroom and other things were in clean condition. Pick up and drop facility was arranged by travel agent. Staff of the hotel was cleaning the room regularly. 24 hours hot and cold water facility was there. Check-in and check-out facility was not delayed. Outer and inner look of the hotel was good. I preferred my food inside the hotel and it was fine. Activities were available there but it was not included in my package. They did not organize sightseeing trip for us. Overall, my stay there was fine. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends. They should be increasing the varieties of food like North Indian, etc.

It was a good hotel and it was easy to find this hotel. The appearance of the hotel was clean and the interior was good. The booking was done through online and the staff service was good. There was no delay while allotting the room and they provided food it was good. They arranged for sightseeing and the rooms were big and neat. The rooms had a mountain view and they were games available in the evening time. We stayed there for 4 days and there was a parking space available. We went in the month of January 2014 and I stay in Chennai.

It was a honeymoon trip. Location was fine. DJ and other activities were available. Rooms were neat and clean. TV, AC, geyser and other basic amenities were available. Food was tasty. Hotel was value for money and recommendable for travelers.

Location of White Mist (a Sterling holiday resort) is perfect. This hotel is easily accessible from the city. The surroundings of the hotel are cozy and soothing. Hotel appearance is average. Staff were good enough and very supportive. Front office is quick. Room is spacious, neat and also clean with well maintained facilities. Good mountain view is available from the room. Food is good and tasty, and also they have their own continental food court inside the hotel itself. No problem and delay during check-in and check-out. Overall stay is good. For anyone preferring to stay in Manali, White Mist is the good choice for the economical budget.

Well, the hotel was okay but I had some issues with the premises of the hotel and its drawbacks. Firstly, the hotel had two buildings, the one building was quite high and to my surprise with no lift facility so reaching at the third floor was a massive task and the other thing was that the interior of the room was little bit old fashioned, otherwise, everything was fine. Room was spacious. Hotel was located near about 2 km from the main market and it was situated adjacent to the Club Mahindra resort and it was a nice location. Inside and outside look of the hotel was good. Housekeeping and staff were nice. Money wise, the hotel was valuable. Mountain view was visible from the room window and it was nice view. Washroom was neat and clean but also it was little bit old fashioned. Hospitality of the hotel was fine. I preferred room service for my food. Restaurant facility was available there and I think it was good. Quality and taste wise, the food was nice. Swimming pool was not available in the hotel but some indoor games were available there like chess, table tennis, etc. I visited there by own vehicle with my family for relaxation. Parking facility was available in the hotel but it was small. They guided us for sightseeing trip and also there was rainy one day so they provided the umbrella.

The hotel was little far, but I had my own vehicle, so it was not difficult to reach. The hotel was 3 km from the bus stand. The staff behaviour was excellent. The appearance like interior was well maintained and exterior was average. The room was spacious, neat, clean and well maintained. The amenities like AC, TV and geyser were in working condition. I can see the river view from the room. The bathroom was neat and clean. They provide food in buffet and a la-carte system. The indoor activities were provided. The sightseeing trip was organized by the hotel. There was no delay in check-in and check-out. This destination was more than value for money. I would like to recommend this hotel to other travellers. I don't have any suggestion for improvement of the hotel.

I visited Manali and stayed in White Mist-Manali. We had booked a studio apartment so it had all the facilities like kitchen(small one), sauna etc, so we enjoyed it a lot. And the scenic beauty from the balcony was simply exotic. Nice place to stay and food was good too.

Our stay at White Mist Manali was in the month of Feb 2014. The stay was very good and we would say it is a wonderful resort. Our check-in was at around 3 PM and was very smooth. The food was of excellent quality and we really enjoyed all the breakfast we had during our 3 day stay. The service staff was very helpful and responsive. The only issue we had was the location of the hotel. But other than that, it was a wonderful experience...

Our stay at White Mist Manali was in the month of Feb 2014. The stay was very good and we would say it is a wonderful resort. Our check-in was at around 3 PM and was very smooth. The food was of excellent quality and we really enjoyed all the breakfast we had during our 3 day stay. The service staff was very helpful and responsive. The only issue we had was the location of the hotel. But other than that, it was a wonderful experience...

The resort is located away from busy city of Manali. It offered excellent valley view from the balcony. The resort offers kitchen facility an addition to the restaurant. One can take city bus from the road outside the resort to go to Manali. There is play area facility for children inside the resort.

Overall, my experience there was excellent. I did direct booking. There was no problem in getting room and in check-in or check-out. They gave us very good discount. All was well there. I stayed there for 4 days. Manali was an excellent place. Location of the hotel was good. Appearance of the hotel from inside and outside was excellent. It was spacious, neat and clean. Booking and front office people were excellent. Services were also excellent. Nature wise, staff was very helpful. Very good hospitality was there. They used to clean the room and all everyday. Heater, TV, etc. were available in the room. Room was very spacious. Good view was visible from the room. Overall room was excellent. Its ambience was superb I liked it very much. We took only breakfast there. We preferred veg food there. Every variety of food was available there. Price wise, it was average. Food was very good. Disco and other activities were available there. Activity part was below average. I went there in December 2011 along with my family to see mountains and for relaxation both. I will definitely recommend it to other travellers.

The hotel though located a bit-off from the market place yet was at easy reach with car or a pleasant walk of one odd kilometer. The hotel had all the amenities of 4 to 5 star hotel. The staff was courteous. The food was good and reasonably priced. The Sterling has a very convenient scheme of one breakfast and one main meal of dinner or lunch under buffet scheme named FOOD MASTI. WE enjoyed the holiday very much and would like to recommend other friends and would like to visit ourselves also.

Location is okay. Staff and service was good. The trip was very relaxing. Food was very good. The hotel is conveniently located. I stay in that hotel whenever I visit there. Appearance was good both interior and exterior. Staff and service was good. Rooms were good and all amenities were working well. The hotel was good. There was no view from the room. There were a buffet system and room service in the hotel. There was no delay in check in and check out. The hotel is value for money. There were no activities in the hotel. The overall experience was good. I would recommend this hotel to others. Overall the stay was value for money. The hotel is neat and clean. My suggestion is to add new bed sheets and pillows. The overall experience was very good. Hotel needs some maintenance in the garden area. There were activities, but we did not avail it.

My overall experience in the hotel was good. I did not face any difficulty in this hotel. Everything was fine. Hotel arranged cab facility for sightseeing trip. The department of the activities was not too much expert. Restaurant facility was available in the hotel and it was superb and it was newly constructed. It was an old constructed property. Room was neat and clean. The charge of the room was 4000 rupees for one day. AC was not required in the room. I booked deluxe room in the hotel. As a destination, Manali place is awesome. Location of the hotel was average. Appearance of the hotel was okay-okay. I had no problem during check in and check out process. Services were fine. Activities were available in the hotel but they were goes on renovation. I visited there with my family.

Sterling Holidays White Mist, Manali resort is location at an excellent location with good view on Snow Mountains. We stayed for two nights and were allocated room in the adjacent blocks. Rooms are spacious but quite dated. We were told that full renovation would take place soon, which would make this resort quite attractive. Food is average in the restaurant but lot of other restaurants nearby. Fun activities are limited in the resort and service from staff is slow.

During our stay hotel staffs were very courteous, they were very caring and cooperative and attentive to all my needs and good housekeeping services.  The room tariff was around Rs. 1500 per day and room's interior & accessories were good, it was normal, but there was no neat and clean with normal basic amenities.  It was located very convenient and hotel appearance, exterior and interior were good.  They provided veg, non-veg food, but the quality and taste was average.  There were no activities and there was no problem at check in and check out.  I stayed here for 3 days with family for sightseeing places in August 2014 and my native place is Hyderabad and mother tongue Telugu.  I wasn't satisfied and I may not recommend it to others.

The hotel was conveniently located. It was near to the market. The staff behaviour was helpful and friendly. The appearance of the hotel was good. The rooms were spacious, neat, clean and well maintained. All the basic amenities like AC, TV and a geyser were provided. The hill and snow fall view from the room. The gym facility was there. They provide both veg and non-veg in food. The food quality was good. There was no delay during check-in and check-out. They provide sightseeing trips, but I arranged by my own. This destination was value for money. I would like to recommend this hotel for other travellers. It was a family trip. Suggestion to provide travel packages.

It is a good hotel and it was a little costly hotel. It was a package trip and they provided food it was very costly for curd rice they charged Rs. 300. The hotel location was excellent and the appearances of the hotel were good it was looking like a 5 star hotel. There was no delay at check in and check out and the staff service was good. They provided food it was good, but they did not provide south Indian food and breakfast was in a buffet system. The rooms had a king size bed, we took 2 rooms and the tariff was more than 6000/-per day. There were more activities available and it was a family trip for relaxation. We went to this hotel in the month of May 2013.

The view of the hotel was the best thing of the hotel and located in a greenery place. The interior and exterior were excellent. Location was very good and appearance was very nice. The overall service was nice staff were very good and friendly. The room was good and had facilities like heater and geyser, TV were available and satisfied with the room. The food was very good. No activities provided. For overall experience was very good. Recommends others to visit the hotel.

It was our one of the best summer vacation in the resort. Location is pretty good but might get lost while to locate its views are good from the rooms if you have mountain facing rooms. Resort people does some sort of activity every evening for entertainment of guests which is remarkable. Some of the facilities are good but service needs to be improved so is the food menu. Resort is spacious and well spread out with ample of playing space to enjoy with kids or even yourself.

No difficulty in finding the hotel and it is conveniently located near to the city. The internal and external appearance of the hotel is excellent but there was a registration problem in the hotel. There was no problem in parking facility and the room was clean, neat and well maintained. The quality of food was good and there was an activities conducted by the hotel management. Hotel is reasonable for the money. It was a relaxation trip with my family. I would like to recommend other travellers to visit the hotel.

Location of the hotel was excellent and the staff were hospitable and friendly as well as service was fantastic. Food at the hotel was average but the interior and exterior appearance of the hotel was wonderful. No delay found in check-in and check-out process and the rooms allotted to me were commodious, well-ordered and sterile. All the conveniences provided by the hotel were in good condition. They arranged for sight-seeing trip and also there was a good view from the room. I propose this hotel for other travellers as the money is worth for the hotel.

Location of the hotel was good. No issues in reaching the location. Services were good there. Staff people were helpful and hygienic. They were quickly attending our request. Power facility was not good but it was manageable. Interior and exterior wise, it was good. Rooms were hygienic and clean. Everything was in clean condition like pillow, blankets, bed sheets, etc. I took Non-AC room. It was too much cold there and the heater was not working. I complained it to the manager then they recovered the problem. I had food there and it was good. Enough varieties were there in food. No problem in check-in and check-out procedure. Some activities were there and those were also good like indoor games. Sightseeing trip was arranged by them on our request. I would like to recommend it to other travellers.  It is value for money. Heater should have been better and playroom facilities should be improved there.

We booked this hotel as we had heard from many of our relatives about White Mist resorts and this is just besides Holiday Inn, Manali, both of them share a common boundary. Stay is comfortable. No Wifi in hotel. 3 to 4 days in Manali should be sufficient for ones stay here at Manali which would include daily sightseeing. We used to go out everyday after having breakfast to our sightseeing tour and would return back at evening.

Things to note:
Hot water is just for some hours in the morning, no Wifi at hotel and value for money hotel.

Travel desk in at the basement and one can book the cab for your stay duration for taking you to the sightseeing locations.

Month visited was October 2013 and we could see all the places. Heard Rohtang Pass closes down in November due to heavy snowfall, so one should plan a little before.

Resort was conveniently located for me. I liked the taste and quality of the food. I am vegetarian so I tried only veg food there.  Swimming pool, gym, indoor and outdoor games were there. They were good. Inside and outside look of the resort was decent.  Manali as a tourist destination is very good. Hotels location was good. Appearance wise, it was also good. Booking was done through online. There was no check in or check out delay. Booking and front office people were good. Overall service was good. Room was spacious, clean, and well maintained. AC, TV, geyser, and other amenities were functioning well. Room was also good.  Welcome drink was given by them. Food and drink was good. Activity part was very good. I went there with my family for relaxation in October 2013.

It was a relaxation holiday with my family in May month 2012. Location was good and it was situated at convenient. Ambiance of the hotel was superb. I booked my room through travel agent. Booking and front office was fabulous. Pick and drop facility was available. Staff behavior was friendly and cooperative. Services were quick and on time. Rooms were neat, clean and spacious. I took just breakfast in the hotel and it was tasty. Activities were nice. Destination is fine for travel. I will recommend this hotel for tourists.

Resort was very good. Resort was located at comfortable place and I reached easily resort. I did book my room in the resort directly on my arrival. Resort look form outside and interior was OK. Staff service and behavior was acceptable. Room was clean and furnished. They did provide basic amenities in the room such as TV, bed, blanket, geyser, etc. Food was present there with veg and non veg categories both of was fantastic. Activities were present in the resort but I did not participate. This property is recommendable and value for money. I traveled Manali place with my family for relaxation.

Resort was very good. It was located at comfortable place. I did book it on the spot when I reached there. I did not face any problem during check in and check out. Staff was very cooperative and helpful. Room was very well maintained and well spacious it was facilitated with TV, AC, bed, blanket, etc. I took veg food there it was delicious. Resort was well maintained and furnished from outside and inside. Front office people were attractive. Activities were fine. Mahabalipuram destination is lovely place for outing. I traveled this place in April month with my friends.

I had a good experience over there. It was conveniently located nearby the city. Appearance wise, it was good. Everything was good there. Service was good and the rates were also affordable. Room facility was good. It was spacious and well-maintained. All varieties in food were available there. Activities were also there. Swimming pool was not there. Location of the hotel was good. Appearance wise, it was good. Everything was good like booking, staff service, room, food, activities, etc. Manali as a destination is good. I visited there in December 2012 with my family. It was a relaxation trip.

Hotel location is good. Reception staff and housekeeping were very kind to serve. Food is very good, you get a variety of foods (South Indian, North Indian & western). Rooms are good & neat. Room Heaters are ok ok. Overall, a very good stay. Nice mountain views outside the Hotel.

My overall experience was excellent in this hotel. Location was fabulous. Hotel was located at about 2 km from the Mall road. Staff was cooperative. Look wise the hotel was awesome. I stayed for 4 to 5 days in this hotel. Rooms were well decorated, neat and clean. All basic amenities were available like TV, AC, geyser, etc. Hill view was available from the room. Food was fantastic. There was no delay in check in and check out. Many indoor and outdoor activities were available. It is a recommendable hotel for travelers.

Manali place is fabulous for travel. Location was average. Look wise the hotel was fantastic. Reception of the hotel was awesome. Services were fully satisfactory. Rooms were well managed, neat and clean. Hotel was value for money and recommendable for others.

Hotel was very good. I went there by public transport. Pick up and drop facility was there. Location and appearance were nice. Rooms were very spacious, neat, clean, and well-maintained. Welcome drink was not given. They did not provide complimentary breakfast. Food was not up to the mark. Booking and front office staff was perfect. Staff behavior was helpful and friendly. Overall services were perfect.  Activities were available like gym, swimming pool, etc but I did not use.  It was value for money paid. They arranged a sightseeing trip for us. I went there with my wife and it was romantic and relaxing trip.  Manali is a beautiful place as tourist destination.

It is a wonderful place to visit. The ambiance was great, so was the food and the hospitality. I stayed there in this resort for 8 days. Great service and very good location of Hotel, near from all main places. Dining arrangement was nice. Overall it was very pleasant stay there.

It was very cold in the month of January first week and all area was packed with snow but management was too good. We were enjoyed very much and dining arrangement was nice. Overall it was very pleasant stay; there was play station and indoor games which helps for children. Room size was very good and stay was great.

Resort was located at on hill area and resort?s surrounding was apple trees. Food was available in the resort it was tasty. But usually I made food myself. Cocking material was also available in the room. Bonfire activity arranged by the resort in evening time. It was a 3 star property. Room was comfortable and toilet was attached. All basic amenities were present in the room like kitchen with all kitchen appliances, bed, table, etc. Location of the resort was very good. Look wise it was beautiful. Check-in and check-out procedure was timely. Staff service was not arranged by the resort. There was self service. Reception staff was good behaviour and helpful. Manali as a tourist destination is excellent and decent place for travel. I visited this place with my family in October 2005. It was our relaxed holiday.

I had a great experience in Manali Streling Resort. The hotel had all facilities. Very good food and room service. Reception and restaurant was very good. Overall, services and location was very good.

It’s a beautiful place and I have been there with my friends. We really had a lot of fun. The ambiance was great, so were the food and the hospitality. I stayed there in this resort for eight days. Rooms were neat, clean, and spacious. Rooms were well furnished with all basic amenities as TV, geyser, AC, etc., were there in the rooms and we were allotted with Duplex rooms

Overall, my experience was good in this hotel. Sterling as a destination was good. It is not a recommendable hotel. It is located 4 to 5 km away from the railway station. Location of the hotel was below average. Appearance of the hotel was average. Booking was done through my friend and booking procedure was average. Service of the staff was good. Room was average.  Complimentary breakfast was only provided by them. Food was below average. Activity was also below average.

Everything was good in this hotel like ambiance, service, and other things. Location was excellent. Hotel was situated at 5 to 10 minutes distance to the prime location. Rooms were neat, clean, and spacious. Coffee maker, small fridge, microwave, sofa and other basic amenities were available. Outside view was available from the room window. Food was fantastic. All varieties were available in veg and non-veg. Inner and outer look of the hotel was fabulous. Reception was well behaved and helpful. Services were fully satisfactory. Many indoor games were available in activities. Activities were nice. Manali place is mind blowing to travel. I traveled there in September with friends. I will recommend this hotel to travelers.
