We stayed at White Mist Manali in the month of June 2014. Its was a pleasant stay at there and a wonderful resort. Food was of excellent quality and staff was very supportive and it was very relaxed out there. My wife and I enjoyed every day at resort. Activities was very good and spa was nice.

The resort is ideally located with an elegant appearance. Very attentive reception gave us a warm welcome, food is excellent and good dining atmosphere. Indoor activities arranged daily. They took good care in arranging local tours and I suggest this place for anybody visits Manali.

Hotel service is good. I had been there with my spouse and we had a great time there. We enjoyed in this hotel. Staff was very helpful and their hospitality was remarkable. I will recommend this to others.

Hotel reception is very good and rooms are neat and clean. Staff is always attentive. Hotel food is too good and garden is also nice. Stay is very relaxing and massage parlor is too good. Hotel outer area is very nice. Indoor games are very entertaining.

I stayed there in this resort for 8 days.  Rooms were neat, clean, and spacious.  Rooms were well furnished with all basic amenities as TV, geyser, AC, etc., were there in the rooms.  I take only veg food there.  Food was okay.  I went there with my friends.  I can recommend this resort to other travelers.  Services were excellent.  Hotel location is perfect.  Appearance wise hotel is well maintained.  Manali as a tourist place is average.  Gym was available there.  There was a park area for children as well.

We stayed here in February and we had a wonderful experience with my family. We enjoyed a lot there. Staff was so friendly and cooperative, rooms were neat and clean, and food was excellent. We had a good fun in rohtang and my family enjoyed the snow. We did lots of shopping. Overall we had a good trip in Manali.

I stayed there for seven days.  It is a 5-star hotel.  Rooms were very neat and clean.  Rooms were very nice.  Both veg and non-veg food was available.  Food was okay.  They gave us room and kitchen and left it to us whatever we want to do there.  Bathroom was neat and clean.  Staff behavior was friendly and professional.  Services were best there.  Games area and swimming pool were available there.  I went there with my family in May 2013.  It was quite a relaxed trip.  The location of hotel is very good.  A nice view was visible from my room.  Appearance is excellent.  There were no problems with the booking staff.  Booking services were perfect.  Manali as a tourist place is beautiful.

We Visited Manali, on the 2013 X-Mass eve traveling by road from Simla after a good visit in Delhi. The Snow all over the place was a life time experience and My family enjoyed very much. The Christmas special dinner was grand the rooms and services were better than their Ooty and Kodai resorts. The food was also nice. The prices were on the upper side but we enjoyed it. We will give 5 to 6 points out of 7 for the location, service and check-in check-out.

We went for a holiday trip to Dharamshala. We stayed at the Sterling Holidays White Mist. Though the hotel is bit away from the main city, the services offered by the hotel and the hospitality of their staffs is very much appreciated. The rooms were neatly maintained. There were heaters provided in every room and the quality of the mattresses and the pillow were awesome, they were very neat and clean too. The food was also very tasty. I would recommend sterling resorts for anyone who visits Dharamshala.

I visited Manali with my family in Aug'13. The basic amenities are below average.The resort is some distance away from the mall road.

However the staff were warm and helpful.Bathroom were untidy and not up to the standard.the weather was decent around this time of the year.

We visited manali on 15th Feb 2014 . We were sleeping in bus when we reached and when we opened our eyes it was so beautiful. I saw snowfall for the first time and it was so beautiful. The drivers were finding it hard to drive on these snows covered roads and because of that we reached our hotel after much delay. We booked a room in Sterling Holidays White Mist and due to the snowfall the name was sounding apt. It was snow all over and a very new very different silence. About the hotel i would say, its spacious they have a nice lawn and the thing i liked the most is their indoor activity room. There was something for everybody. Indoor games for children, billiards table for adult and in the night time they arranged a disc party over there. In all it was good. The rooms were not very grand but they were ok. Furniture looked a bit old. But overall it was ok. The good part was they had a microwave in the room and the bad part was hot water was only supplied for few early hours of the day, which i think the hotel management should  think over . Hot water is a must especially in that cold weather. It’s so hard even washing hands with cold water. The staffs were good and i would give five stars to the location of the resort that is just opposite a wine shop which was well stacked. They had all from the very much required rum to party lover’s tequila. So no worries to carry your booze with you . Its imp to mention they even had captan morgan also in their rum section. The food was also good .if you are looking for a relaxed holiday then book this place as it is a little far from the market. I think it was one of the best hotel in that place. So i would suggest either Sterling Holidays White Mist.  All in all it was a nice holiday.

Very pleasant to stay good sight seeing. Nice place where the sterling is Located. Rooms are nice and food also good. nice activities for children fire camp is good arrangements. Good location to watch the mountain from sterling restaurant is nice arrangement. Good wash room neat and clean television set also nice.

It is a good hotel and in terms of food it is excellent and even stay is also very good. Overall a good experience. You can visit solang valley or rotang for snow rides but you need to bargain for rides which you play.

I stayed in this hotel for two  nights and three days. altogether it was amazing experience. food and hospitality met my expectation.I would really recommend this hotel to my friends and colleague if they plan for Manali trip. The location was very good.there were also many activities conducted. overall the stay was good.

It was a good experience. We were treated really well. It's a bit far from the city. The room are big and fully and has wooding flooring. The room service is good and stay very clean. The hotel has its own spa which was very good. Food was good but very expensive. As the hotel is bit far from the city so you don't have much option also.

There was only one problem. The road which leads to the hotel was very narrow. It feels very terrible to go on this path on a horse.

Have to say...Food was very good...rooms are clean...staffs does a great job...
Excellent reception....touring facilities are really good...wont forget staying there..
Overall experience was really good....
Will stay there again if I go again.

It was a memorable & WOW holiday staying in the hotel.The location of the hotel is very good, away from the crowd. The market place was not too far away. The hotel staff was hospitable.The rooms were spacious.And the food served here was also very good. We really enjoyed staying here..

Manali- White Mist, A Sterling Holidays Resort, manali is exieting place to spend your  honeymoon. Its was homely atmosphere and food was excellent rooms were neat n clean and very big very big window so that fresh air can come in side. Staff was well behaved courteous. Veiw was gr8 enjoyed the holiday with my family I recommend this resort to all my friend.

Hotel is best yo stay we went with family and , my son enjoyed his stay there , activities such as housie , magic show indoor games were the best and food , rooms and location was the best thing.i recommend others also to visit there. Hotel is outside the main city but markrt is accessible easily and .surrounded by hills and river.nice virw from the balcony.

It was resly nice to spend holiday. Its was homely atmosphere  and food was excellent rooms were neat n clean and very big very big window so that fresh air can come in side. Staff was well behaved courteous. Veiw was gr8 enjoyed the holiday with my family I recommend this resort to all my friend. Some time their was no hot water.

Hotel is very nice.... Dining menu is excellent.... Excellent service .
Location is nice.... Beautiful mountain view from dining hall / Rooms .
Just 1/2 km away from the city central....So near to city also away from crowd....
Have all activities planned / guided from hotel itself.
Rooms are excellent.

It was a fantastic holiday experience in manali while staying in sterling white mist.All the facilities,indoor activities staff and food was very good and the best part is the location of the resort which is far from the meddling crowd and very good for a perfect holiday.It was the wonderful time of my life. I will be thinking of going again.

Great Experience. Well located resort. Rooms need to be upgraded as they are beginning to show signs of ageing. Staff is well mannered and responsive. Food in the dining room was reasonable. Could be better. Welcome kit was good.

The trip to the destination and hotel was for my honeymoon. Hence it was a very important trip for my wife and me.The destination and the hotel management made this trip really memorable. The manali beauty and the Hotel management service made us very happy and memorable.
The hotel is in a nice calm location. Decent and neat room with kitchen. Refillings are done in time. My kids enjoyed the activties/games there than going outside. Good food and prompt service.

it was pretty good the resort organized evening parties and all so was a good chance to go along with different people moreover dey  organized some quite amzing trekking trips such as jogni fall which left me spellbound.

It was a memorable stay at Manali. One of the mos6t beautiful place in North India. Hotel compliment your stay in all aspects. Excellent food at very affordable price. Full of activities very friendly staff. Excellent place to visit. But I recommend not visit Manali in opeak season. April bigining and Oct are the best months

very good. We enjoyed the snow capped mountains. We also went to the pass leaving the resort at 4AM and was there for sometime. It was a fabulous experience. Next we went to the paragliding area and that was a phenomenol experience from my family.

it was really a wonderful experience to stay in a beautiful well decorated Resort in Manali hotel. i went on 30th Dec.2012 with my husband  to celebrate this New year 2013, We enjoyed with the hotel facilities in all aspects like Breakfast, Dinner. Especially 31st Night Gala Dinner Celebrations are wonderful and unforgettable moment in our life time. We highly recommend any one to go and choose this hotel without any hesitation. Worth to pay money for this type of high quality hotels.  Thanks with Regards,

We stayed at Manali STERLING Holiday . Fantastic location with great views. The service was absolutely fantastic. Very friendly people and were always ready to help. The food was great, especially dinner with a wide variety of choices. Hot tea and milk were availlable at all times which was very helpful especially with the cold weather outside. Highly recommended.

Best experience among all the holidays i had been was here. the view from the hotel room was awesome. the service and the snow white mountains seen from the hotel room window, is one that a person can never forget.

It was a gr8 Experience staying there.
the activities arranged daily in activity area,Lawns,View from the rooms, Staff behavior and most importantly food and the ambience of the hotel are all excellent.
i would suggest this hotel to any body coming to Manali.

Overall hotel is ok.not that great.food is not good and very expensive compare to any hotel in manali.bathroom fiting need to change.pipe is leeking.
Staff r very good.overall not satisfactory but not bad too.
stayed with my family good experience lots of facilities spa,pool table,badminton,tt,video games,travel desk to help you for free,nice rooms with 4 persons can stay together in duplex apartments.

The Hotel was away from the madening rush of Mall Road.It was a nice n peaceful Stay.The Rooms were Spacious, Uninterupted Water supply, Food was Excellent Too.The Hotel had Many Indoor Gaming Facilities.It was a nice Time staying there.

We got a duplex room overlookind the valley.
The room and the view is fantastic and lingers on the mind for long.
While leaving the room there is an option to intimate housekeeping that you dont want to clean the bed spreads (to conserve water for the environment) and instead opt for rearranging the bed sheets only.

It was a lovely experience.We had taken two rooms.The service provided was very good.
Breathtaking view from the rooms.Delicious food & good family activities.
Waiting to visit another Sterling Property soon.
it was a great experience to be in manali. We had lot of adventure things going on there. Paragliding, river rafting, river crossing and much more.. It was great fun and adventurous trip

It is a decent family resort with facilities suiting them. The room service was very quick. The rooms are neat, spacious and cool  Facilities were decent with a small kitchen inside the room. location of the surrounded by lots of trees as it is hilly area.

The resort was superb. It had all the facilities in it. Lovely surroundings and clean the food was very tasty, delicious.. The service was fast and super.. The rooms was large and comfortable the window was open with mind blowing air.. The staff was friendly and respectful.. the all the facilities was given this resort..

The room service was very quick. The staff were also very courteous. Some of the facilities are good but service needs to be improved so is the food menu. resort is spacious and well spread out with ample of playing space to enjoy with kids or even yourself.The room service was very good.
Its an awesome resort to stay at...the appearance was awesome and the rooms were really nice...loved the ambiance and the hospitality of the resort...

great location outstanding facility in this stay, experienced great,  The location is pretty. Well laid out and neat. staff that is courteous and helpful.  Food was nice taste a nice stay with great experience.

Sterling in Manali is situated in very quite and calm location though the outer look isn\'t that great or attractive. Rooms are good, spacious and comfy with clean bathrooms. Service is also good. Food can be much better as i have tried in their other branches as well.

great location lovely stay, the location is preety, the hotel was opp to holiday inn, well maintained surroundings, very clean rooms, staff that is courteous and helpful. nice stay with good experience.

great location nice stay, good quality of food very delicious, well maintained rooms, neat bathrooms,  But needs maintainance in the hotel, excellent staff very helpful, interiors was great loved this location, all over a nice stay with good experience.
lovelly location. it is a beautiful hill station. it is must visit. the rooms are very cozy and nice. you can have a great view from the room.but no much activities. food is good.

Beautiful the resort is and more is the location .The surroundings of the resort adds on to the beauty of the resort .  I was in love with our rooms .... very cozy place . Overall good resort with all good facilities .

Sterling is amongst the best hotel chains in India and we did really have a pleasant stay at this hotel. The scenery from the bay and the balcony were breathtaking. Spping on to hot tea we enjoyed our time well.

it was awesome destination, very nice and a great location of the hotel, excellent service, very nice and a helpful staff, surroundings was very great, neat and a huge rooms, food was tasty very good, over all it was a very nice stay.
Sterling resorts manali is one of the finest hotel of Manali.  The food, room and service is very good and everything is nice about the place
best destination ... the environment is very pure free from pollution... the hotel is best for the activities they provide ... the food is delicious.
it is an excellent hill station.. the best is the weather i loved it its so moist  and pleasant. and the food there is very different it is good for a change. it ws comfortable staying there
fanastic, memorable and a peaceful place to stay with the natures bounty
The location is good,surroundings can be improved.no activities. the food is good...oh forgot about the room tats also good.
the property was very nice, the room service was good, specially the room was occupied by heater & mini kitchen.

Excellent food,stay,kitchen facility and superb snowladded mountain view with a ice-cooled winter breeze which gives us a ultimate spiritual and feeling of relaxation.a complete family vacation site for nature lovers.
resort is good, some maintenance and good services will attract more tourists.

It was a great and good experience, Manali is a beautiful hill station. So-lang nala, Rotan pass, and Hadimba temple. These were the places we had gone and the new experience we had was Paragliding.  Overall our family had a great time there .
I was impressed with the lawn maintained by the hotel. Hotel staff was courteous and well mannered. I found food quality good. Hotel has indoor activities which are descent.

Ideally located just 3km from thje mall road, it is a perfect location amidst mountains and snow. The food quality is also very good. Wonderful place to relax your nerves and enjoy the natural beaty all around.
it was awesome and amazing trip.the 1st snowfall of the season was lovely.

The location of the hotel is a plus since it is away from the hubbub of Manali town on Naggar road. The hotel is reasonably well-maintained, with rooms in good condition and clean bathrooms. The food was above average. The good part is that unlike most resorts, they don't try to fleece you in the food prices but have kept them very reasonable. Since it is a resort, they do organize a fair number of activities where one can participate and are quite pro-actvie about it.
Hotel Situated at very good Location. Site scenes are beautiful. Hotel needs maintaince. Walls of hotel are damp.

It was a great experience in Manali, we loved the place and about Sterling they are located in a good location where we have a good mountain view. They have a good kitchen set up and good room service too. The rooms are bit old and needs some renovation.

We had a nice time at Sterling Resort..The only drawback is that the resort has very limited staff & it takes time if you order anything in room...so room service is slow...also have electricity problem...But overall a decent experience....
so near yer so far   perfect location centrally located
We had a great trip to Manali and the snowfall was great.
had a very cold holiday. my first holiday to the north. pleasant experience. thanks to the room heaters helped me in not turning to kulfi.

The resort is located around 10 mins drive from the Manali town, bus stand. Although it doesnt boast of any large front view of greenery (unlike its neighbour star hotel), once inside, the services are great which is  typical of any Sterling group  we have visited earlier... What we liked is the view from the bedroom which opens to the nearest snow capped mountain, we could see snow building up with rains and towards evening, most of the mountain gets covered and with day light, the snow starts melting out....natures beauty was here to be enjoyed and experienced right from the resort room....The food was hygienic and tasty, their chilli-cheese bread toast became a favourite dish for my daughter ever since. Having access to the internet at the resort at that location  was very helpful in our time of need, ofcourse with a little extra cost...
it was great experience
it was the bast thats why i want to go again this year .the children had a blast in activities at night....games
The hotel is good.Restaurant is also good. Service is also good.
Sterling Manli is a good and safe place in Manali. They offer all type of food and other activities, they dont have bar inside the restaurant.

situated in a quiet location in naggar road a little away from the city. Rooms are very good excellent toilet. food is great  A lot of activities like bon fire and indoor games like table tennis and disco .There is evan a small library for book lovers.
it was fantastic
Excellent and enjoyable mountain experience

Overall the experience was good, they did organise a lot of events during the night which was well attanded and was enjoyable.But it did lack creativity.

Overall the food quality is good, but menu is full of rich food.The Menu can have some non-rich food as well

Location is not very good, though the views are... The resort could have been a little further away from the main town in a calmer place
nice location. good service.

Sterling Manali is one of the better maintained resorts of Sterling. The Resort is on the other side of River Beas in an area popularly known as New Manali. This gives the visitor an ample peace of mind after a long journey to Manali as compared to hotels/resorts situated on or about the Mall Road. The resort is beautiful and the service and facilities satisfactory. A functioning library, play area and working Activity Department which arranges bon-fires, housies, fun-fairs, etc. everyday comes as a pleasant surprise. The food is OK. The travel desk does not arrange for regular sightseeing tours [as is done in certain other Sterling Resorts] however customized bookings can be done. Always press for a room to be given in the old block rather than being pushed into the new block. Overall, it is a satisfying experience
Best of all Sterling Resorts. Excellent service. Great mountains.Good food. Reasonable appearence

Arriving at Manali after a long road journey, with kids, we were thankfully escorted to our room in quick time. The room, located on the 3rd floor was very difficult to access, for elders, as there was no lift !  Putting this behind us, i quickly decided to draw the curtains open to look for the mountains, having read so much about them right here at India Resort Survey and ...well...with a strained neck i managed to spot the snow-caps in all their glory! Fabulous site ! But if one were to look down from the 3rd floor, the site was pathetic, to say the least. (More about that in \'My Worst Experience\' below!) Sadly the property dint have much open area to hand out in, but a small neatly landscaped lawn. Breakfast was a disaster (i strongly suggest  that one avoids their buffet breakfast!), while the food served at dinner was quite ok.
Recreational activities ? Another disaster ! Best is to just enjoy the mountains. The weather during the 2nd week of May, was quite warm during the days and at nights just a full-sleeved shirt was quite comfy. Restaurants to visit : \'Cafe River Music\', near Club House and \'Brook Song Flower Garden\', on the Naggar Road, past Sterling! Ambience at these 2 places was absolutely fantastic!
Resort was good but it lacks in quality service. Also maintenance was not up to mark. Hopefully with passage of time things will improve.

Excellent place, service is good and very cordial staff.  But they don't have 24-hour hot water facility. Thus, many a times if you feel like taking a warm shower, well, no luck. They say no other resort at Manali has 24-hour hot water facility, which I do not believe.
The location and over all ambience is very pleasant and its a value for money option for visitors
Manali is a great place to be in. The ambience and the look & feel of the resort could have been much better

Ideal room for honeymooners since the room is equipped with kitchen and cooking utensils with stove! Great way to start off a married life...
Excellent surroundings, helpful staff.
It was a nice refreshing week long trip in lap of nature and majestic snowclad mountains on all sides.Wish to be here every year.
Nice place. But the resort is not as good as the other sterling resorts.
Very good service and good location
It is a typical hotel kind of resort instead of cottages as others are. rooms are just ok with heaters not working up to mark.
Nothing less than fantastic+fabulous = FANTABULOUS
I had gone on a honeymoon trip. It was a really exhiliarating experience. The place is simply splendid for a honeymoon trip.

I started from Chennai to Manali with my family during the holidays in the month of May. After a long journey of more than 2500km we reached Manali at morning 7.30 but check in time was 12 noon. Keeping in mind our long journey, the receptionist attended us warmly and informed about check in time and room availability after 12 noon and we understood the technical problem. But he directed the staff to look after our luggage and transfer them to our room. Residing at the resort was very memorable on many aspects, as from our room we could view snow-peaked mountains and very beautiful scenery and calm atmosphere. No hustle and bustle just realizing the true life. Me, my better half Kiran, my daughter Deepika and my son Mehul, all of them enjoyed a lots of games dancing/disco and food. At home still whenever we sit the memories come in front of our eyes, and again we would like to go there, now not for just two days but more....

Though a little far from the main hustle bustle, it was value for money with lovely cooperative staff. Its a nice place to relax and enjoy the nature. The rooms are good and lot of activities for kids as well let's not forget the swimming pool, gaming zone, spa etc.

Our experience at Villagio, South Goa has been HORRIBLE. We travelled in a group of 5 couples and had planned 3 days in North Goa & 2 days in South Goa.
We had placed all of our bookings in South Goa at Villagio - A Sterling resort about 50 days in advance. The complete payment was made in advance by us. On the day we were supposed move from North Goa TO South Goa & check-in @ Villagio hotel, we received a call late in the evening from Villagio hotel manager - "Manish"(when our check-in time has already passed by 5 hours !!  Who informed us that a complete block of the hotel is under maintenance as a result of which they wouldn't be able to provide us the rooms.
We decided to go to Villagio Hotel to speak to the manager & sort out the matter. TO OUR SURPRISE (& SHOCK) WE FOUND OUT THAT THE BLOCK UNDER MAINTENANCE HAD BEEN ALLOCATED TO DEFENCE EXPO RESERVATIONS THAT WAS HAPPENING DURING THAT WEEK !!!
The hotel management was FLATLY LYING on the maintenance reason. On learning this information we challenged Villagio staff to show us the block under maintenance. This request was again denied.
So probably what happened is - Villagio Hotel Management gave our (& probably other folks) reserved rooms to some foreign customers who were willing to PAY MORE as a part of the block deal.
The most disappointing thing here is the complete UNPROFESSIONAL & UNETHICAL hotel management that gave importance to earn MONEY rather than CUSTOMER LOYALTY.
Villagio hotel offered us ONLY 2 properties in NORTH Goa. We again & again tried to explain to Villagio Hotel manager - "Manish" that all of 2 days activities were planned in South Goa. So North Goa was NOT a viable option for us. But he failed to understand this fact repeatedly.
Only available option in South Goa was some 5 star properties that Villagio was NOT willing to compensate. Ultimately we had to search on our own and settle down for a hotel in Panjim. Again we had to do at least 30 - 40 follow-ups for getting the payment for this NEW hotel reimbursed with Villagio hotel management.
Overall, our experience with Villagio in South Goa has been HORRIBLE.
NOT only our entire trip plan was disrupted, the HOTEL management did NOT even have the courtesy to talk to us politely and follow up with us to check on the arrangement in the alternate hotel that we had booked.
VERY UNEXPECTED & SAD for a big chain like Sterling Holidays.
. Tripadvisor.

I had visited this hotel with my family. The activity was arranged by the hotel. The staff's behaviour was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was located in the room. I didn’t face any problem while reaching the hotel. All the facility was provided in the room in working condition. The allotted room was neat and clean. The complimentary breakfast was provided. The garden was available at the hotel. All kind of food was provided at the hotel. The Wi-Fi facility was provided in the room. There was no suggestion for this hotel.

Rooms are spacious but toilets are not planned properly only bathtub is placed, out side rooms are not cleaned every day all the garbage of other rooms are kept on steps for more than 3 to 4 hours it was not removed for a day and cups and plates of food are lying on steps for every small things we need to call them like tissue roll, water, etc. Staffs are good but some where I felt service is lacking.

Very pleasant atmosphere, Proper cleaning & well-maintained resort, almost all facilities are available, little bit far from Beach. Food Quality was awesome, Swimming pool is well-maintained & Clean. Food rates are very costly for middle class family so, try to get it with package. Rooms & Bathroom are well-maintained. Lift is not available. Value for money and suitable for middle class family. Location is far away from Panaji. Travel only by own car.

We travelled to Goa for our vacation and stayed at Goa -Villagio, A Sterling Resort which is located near Betalbatim beach. The resort is located around half a km from the beach and hence, the location is just perfect.
Upon reaching the resort, the check-in took too long. The persons handling the reception area were not at all retrained. They kept yawning constantly (at around 2. 30 in the afternoon!  And made us wait for around 20 minutes before allotting us a room. Then, we were taken to a room (Room No. 323) which was very small in size and on the 3rd floor with no lift; we refused to check-in into it. Thereafter, we were allotted a much better option (Room No. 411) which was a very spacious room and very much met our expectations.
From then on, we had a very good stay for 2 days. The room was very clean and maintained. The restaurant service was very good and efficient. The restaurant staff was very hardworking and courteous. They can improve upon the buffet spread though ...
But we had a big problem with the TV in our room. The TV simply did not work and was not catching signal. On the 1st evening, they tried to resolve the problem and for that, they were in the room for 2 hours; but to no avail. When I spoke about this with their RM Mr. Rostan, I found him to be very arrogant and rude. His approach sounded like he did not care for his customers.
Apart from that, the stay was very comfortable and we took away a lot of good memories.

Excellent place and hotel. Will always recommend however few improvements required and feedback.
1. Food expensive and not value for money. For eg. I was charged abive Rs. 150 for a plate of pakodas having 12-15 pieces.
2. Food menu very limited you have good options outside
3. Bar menu very limited couldn't many local brands.
4. Was very disappointed with sales executive of sterling resorts who was obviously trying to sell membership, used very unethical way by saying make my trip fooled you for this trip. A very big turn off ...
Over all good place to stay

We did plan for 4 days trip to Goa .. We spent 2 nights 3 days in north Goa and planned to stay in south Goa for 1day and 1 night and we choose "VIllagio, A Sterling Holidays Resort" for that. I called 15 times in 11am to 1pm but nobody thare for pick my call atleast. I have tried there 3 numbers which i got from their site. And then we dont want to take a risk so we didn't go there.

It was Nice stay being at this hotel. Staff was Nice and helping. With pool and activities like Table Tennis, Pool, and other indoor board games. We have been here for two days. The beach was near at walking distance and even away from city rush. It was quite, clam and relaxing.

This was our almost 5th trip to Goa but this one was special the hotel stay was wonderful. Though most of the staff was trainees but they were trying their hard to cope up ...
The place is beautiful, but swimming pool and food need to be upgraded the club host padian was toi good and anthusiastic ...

The service was not good. Even though the check-in time was 12 noon, we got our rooms at 4pm. Food was okay. Swimming pool was not great as, it started with min 5ft depth and there was no 4ft. There was some renovation work going on, so there was lot of mess around and it had directly blocked our way to our rooms. Would not want to go back, due to the poor customer service and professionalism.

Location of the resort is very good & fantastic. Front office response is very bad rather they meant for nothing with the guest. Just for the sake of their profit, their group booking and the room facilities depicted at the time of booking were not provided to us. When we ask to change it, front office staff don't hear the request. The resort has 3 floor buildings but have no elevators at all. It's not mentioned at anywhere at their own website or on Makemytrip site. When we ask for to change & give us at lower floor then front office bluntly said that you have not mentioned at the time of booking or confirmation. A person how can imagine that the resort is with 3 floors buildings & no elevators at all. The room provided to us was not as per the amenities mentioned on the website rather than it was third class 'mumbai's kholi' type very small room. Refrigerator was making the things hot rather than cooling. No bathroom kit provided. No packaged water proved. It's feeling like cheating to us. At the time of check-out also no feedback form provided.

This hotel along with make my trip seems to have decided to make life hell for travellers! Every single thing needs a follow up. Services suck! Nothing seems to be in place! Starting from clearing bills. The amount of tax these people charge god known for what.

Good price with such facilities, breakfast was very good, nearest beach 1km, bar not available, rooms are spacious, food quality and swimming pool are good. Airport pick up not available, budget hotel for family but very peaceful place for yoga meditation, away from airport 18 km but good road.

We stayed here for two nights. Being a Sterling property, we had very high expectations However, the place needs to be be refurbished to look more contemporary. The room had very good air conditioning but smelt of dampness. The curtains need to be changed. 

The breakfast was good and Mr. Bhim Singh was very accommodating as to the quality and suggestions for a good breakfast spread. 

A very helpful staff after the initial checkinn, where mundane formalities were asked. 

The beautiful beach is one km away and one must try the food and hospitality at the Rosa Sunshine Beach Shack. 

Overall, a beautyful stay at the sterling resort at Betalbatim.

This property is located about 5mins from the Betalbatim Beach. Good but an an expensive place, especially if you are not a Sterling Holidays member. Try to get the pool view classic rooms if possible - they have a nice view and is right beside the restaurant. Try to go the restaurant directly instead of ordering room service and you will save a few hundred bucks. Service is average in my opinion. Delayed/laid back response at times and no one answered the front desk phone for over 15 mins when I wanted to check out early morning around 5:30am. I had to walk up to the reception and wake them up.

Very cool and calm place, value for money to stay in the hotel. Staying in South Goa preferred for the people who want to be relaxed. Hotel is situated in nice location, not very far from Beach. 5 star for everything.

Stayed there for 3 days. The location was very good with peaceful environment and the beach is excellent and not so crowded. The rooms were big but cleanliness was average. I stayed in the corner most room(512) and it was stinking. Asked for change of room but the front office didn't allowed in spite of being availability. I would have rated it 5 star if I haven't met mr saurav of front office. He dont know how to deal with customer. Otherwise hotel was good with clean swimming pool and good staff. Gone with my kid 2. 5 yrs old and was provided with kichdi and meals for the kid.

I briefly stayed at this resort on the Times Women's Rally 2016 in March 2016 and found it extremely good value for the money. Will plan to visit again. It has good proximity to the beach, ample parking and enough to keep the kids busy. The included breakfast was good (idlis barring). The service was attentive enough but the resort was crawling with families

Need to Check the bill while Checking-out. Though the accommodation was pre-paid the bill issued had room charges and taxes. Later confirmed that nothing to be paid. Be careful while checking out. Security Guards outside was very courteous. Thanks to their service.

We are a group of 10 friends and made bookings for Villagio-Goa resort for 2 nights (28/29 March).

We have booked this room 2 months back and got confirmation for MMT but hotel simply denied entry to us stating rooms are not available due to some maintenance issue. When I enquired with housekeeping staff, it appeared that Hotel Manager was lying to us. We also requested the Manager to show us what maintenance issue they are facing but he bluntly asked us to leave the hotel.

Hotel Manager, Manish, was very rude and did not even bother to understand our situation. This was the worst experience a customer can expect from self proclaimed 4 star hotel.

I also got to know that this hotel has a reputation of dishonouring its pre-bookings. So please do think twice before booking this hotel for your next trip.

Hotel location is very far from main city but that is not the problem, problem is of local conveyance. The local taxi people has a union and do not allow call taxi to enter there. I paid 600 INR to just 12 Km. Very much loot. Come to the stay. It was okay type as bathroom had a leakage problem through shower point which was resolved after so many follow up. Now come to food in buffet. I stayed there for 3 nights and menu was same for all these days. I was shocked to see this and it was very limited. Service inside the dining hall was very poor as if you ask for a glass of water you will get once you finish your meal very bad. Morning breakfast was worst. Tea quality was much poorer than road side tea shop.

The hotel, I'd recommend, in South Goa. Except for the food, which was unbelievably poor, everything else was just too good for the price we paid. Martin's Corner is a good restaurant very nearby so I'd probably check in again at this hotel and eat at Martin's. Also, it is important to mention that Betalbatim, Majorda and Colva beaches were also very near so this hotel also has a good location. Palolem is far away though and so are other areas accessible from the main Panaji city.

I stayed at this resort for one day. It was a pleasant stay. I liked their restaurant the most. Betalbatim beach is at 10 minutes walking distance from the resort. The only thing that bothered me was it's distance from Margao, it was tough to locate the resort.

Nice place with excellent service. For people who want a silent place closer to nature away from the chaotic traffic. You can rent an Activa just outside the hotel. Going around not so crowded beaches like Nanu beach or to Martin's corner would be a nice time to spend.

The hotel is good, the staff is very cooperative, rooms are very spacious. Value for money. Ambiance is also good. Hotel is quite close to beach. Conveyance is little problem. Food is available but variety is low. At the end the hotel tariff is value for money.

If you are looking for peace and need a place to relax, then this MUST be your selection. What a superb resort, so green, so fresh, so clean. It was a pleasure staying in Villagio. Excellent rooms, food, pool, staff is well behaved and will come here again and again.

This hotel was a five star hotel and I had been to this hotel in the month of November for a vacation. I booked this hotel through online. The staff and the service were normal in condition. We had a welcome in the reception. The outer view of hotel was not much good. Activities like swimming pool and gym was provided. The rooms allotted to us were average in condition and we had all amenities in this hotel. The food provided to us by the management was good. Activities were also conducted by the management. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

The hotel was located little far from the city. The staffs at the hotel were quite good. The surroundings of the hotel were nice. The check in and checkout process was delayed. The appearance of the hotel was looking quite old. The room given to me was neat and well maintained. The amenities were working properly. The room was cleaned regularly. The food was served in the buffet system and the price was expensive. The quality of the food was good. The activities were not arranged by the hotel. The destination was nice place. The hotel was value for money. I would like to recommend this hotel to visit for other travellers.

I stayed in Sterling Holidays Resort in Goa. The location of the hotel is near to the beach where we can go for walk every day. The food quality of the hotel was very good and it was like buffet and multi cuisine. The swimming pool of the hotel was good. The service of the hotel staff was good. There were activities like indoor games and karaoke. There were welcome drinks provided at the hotel. The check-in and check-out was done before time because we reached early. The hotel provides with transport facility. The appearance of the hotel was neat and clean.

This was complete package trip. This hotel is located near to beach. Complimentary breakfast was served. The food served by them was pretty good. Swimming pool and spa was available. Indian, continental food was served. No mini kitchen was available, but Coffee maker was given. Staff members in the hotel were helpful. Reception people were warm. The room allotted to me was spacious, clean and well maintained.

I had been there in Goa and I stayed in Villagio, A Sterling Holidays Resort with friends, it was relaxation trip. I did not find any issues in locating the hotel and booking system was good. The room allotted to me was good and it was well maintained with all basic amenities in working condition. There was a good view from the room. The behaviour of the staffs in the hotel was good and they were helpful, and there was no delay in check in and checkout. The external and internal appearance of the hotel was good. I ate food in the hotel restaurant and it was good in taste and in quality. There were activities organised by the hotel. The destination was good and the stay in the hotel was value for money, and I will recommend this hotel to other travellers.

It was relaxation trip with my friends and I stayed two days in the month of August. This hotel was easy to locate and no difficult to reach the hotel. The room allotted to me was terrific and it was well maintained with all required amenities in working condition. There was a pool view from the room. The food served in the hotel was good in taste but bit costly. The staff members were willing and they were speedy in services. The interior and exterior look of the hotel was good. The check in and check out was done on time. The stay and the destination were good.

I am a member of the Sterling which is why I selected Goa Villagio for my stay at Goa as I knew it was a safe property to reside during my stay. The room was clean and basic but comfortable. After a long day of sight seeing the hotel beds were highly comforting. Clean property with good food and a lovely pool. They have a spa that offers discounts to the hotel guests.

The Good: The only good part of the Resort has been the ever eager staff of the Food and Beverages Team to help but they were handicapped for want of quality food. No fault of theirs. Kudos to all the boys. But they are at the wrong place.
The other good part was Mr. Bins Francis and The Spa.

The Bad: Millions of Mosquitoes. Could not sleep throughout our stay of 8 days. The food was similar to that of a Nature Cure Center. Nothing to offer. Number of items were very limited. Scared you away.
The swimming pool is nearly 6' in depth but there isn't any life guard nor are there any safety devices. This is dangerous.

The Ugly: There was a snake in our room when my wife walked into the wash room around 8.30pm of 9th January. We had returned from a sightseeing tour and went into the room. When she opened the wash room door, down comes the snake from above the door. We don't know where it came from or how. The sad part of it was that there wasn't any Manager who could handle the crisis. We were stuck out for nearly a couple of hours. Desperate calls and Messages to Mr.Bhim Singh does not elicit any response. The Manager on Duty, Mr.Mannister, was not on duty. When called, he says that he is unwell and hence has not come to the Resort. After frantic efforts, The Executive Chef, Mr.Jagjeet Singh and The Activities manager arrive. They were very kind in trying to calm us down but then the damage was done.

The security and housekeeping staff were debating as to what should be done to the snake instead of taking action. They finally decide to eliminate the intruder. But then came the twist - One of the security guards refused to take action citing his religious beliefs. All this while we are suffering. The Housekeeping staff are scared to check the rooms for any other intruders that may be around. They go into the rooms and come out in less than 2 minutes stating all is well. So much for the Resort.

In the meantime, Mr.Bhim Singh decides to be benevolent and calls. When told of the issue and the utter lack of response, says " I am not on Duty". So much for a man who is supposed to be much feted by many. 
A good leader is one who should be decisive in times of crisis. This gentleman gains his reputation by being proactive at normal times and being fussy to serve you when there is hardly anything worth serving.

The Saving Grace: One gentleman stood out in this crowd - Mr.Chirag. When there was chaos all around with the snake, he was calm and composed and finally handled the issue very well. He brought in a lot of comfort and shifted us to different rooms and put us at ease.

My wife has a pacemaker and has a heart condition that could have turned very ugly if something would have happened to her due to the shock. We were fortunate that all is well.
I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Barring a few bright spots such as Chirag, Jagjeet Singh and the Food & Beverage staff, there is nothing else. But what can they do if the property does not have what it takes to make a great Resort.
I would have loved to Title this review as "OH MY GOD THERE IS A SNAKE IN MY ROOM" but felt it to be too melodramatic. Nevertheless, it is almost true. What with the harrowing time we had.

One great destination. Villagio has the best rooms and the standard and quality they maintain is amazing. The service was good. The place was close to the beach. Would like to visit Villagio again. A place to relax and be in peace.

The resort is very good for stay for any trip. Room service is very good. They have to provide free Wi-Fi instead insisting payment. Of course we stayed for a night. South Indian food dish to be improve in taste and make. Idly was not baked. Overall, stay in Sterling is good. Staff are very cooperative.

Really liked the hotel room, cleanliness, pool, and other infrastructure. Very average room service experience. Good variety on breakfast buffet, but very poor in taste. Having your own transportation is very essential, and renting them before reaching here will be better.

After hectic enjoyment in north Goa, we a group reached the resort almost 8 pm. Very first bad experience is, you would need to struggle a lot to set the hot and cold water taps to not get yourself burnt. None of us took a refreshing bath, everyone is annoyed. You don't have lift facility, you would need climb up to whatever the floor you get your room. It's not a resort styled one, it's just a hotel that is closer to a beach. Very less space within the resort to relax and rejuvenate. You would need to spend atleast 1200 INR per couple for one dinner. As no other restaurants are accessible you would end up spending a lot.

The stay was pleasant and the quality of sleep was one of the best as there was a very peaceful environment. The beach was 5 minutes walk and also the bar and swimming pool were well maintained. Some good restaurant like the Martins was nearby and the cabs were present outside always

A very ordinary resort. The resort is in the interior and very difficult to locate. Not much open space as it appears in pictures. Front office staff totally hopeless. Restaurant manager was a truly professional guy. I would not like to go there again.
Nice place to visit for relaxation. Little deep from road side but very calm place. Betalbatim beach is very near just on 10 minutes walking distance, very lovely beach and very less crowded.

Positives - Location (South Goa, 5 - 10 mins from Betalbatim beach - beautiful, not crowded).

Average - Room (good size, but poor amenities, no shampoo in room, only 1 litre water complimentary on arrival, most hotels give 1 litre mineral water everyday). Service, no lift, some staff was good, others seemed uninterested. Breakfast was average (non-veg had only egg - seemed like a budget hotel, serving staff was nice).

Negatives - Housekeeping / Room service staff did not clear plates kept in the hallway for over 2 days even after I complained 5 - 6 times. Terrible response. The food ordered by someone from a neighboring room was stinking and no one was taking it away. Food was quite poor.

Verdict: NOT Value for money. For that money could have got a better place. Went by my previous experience at Sterling Resorts in Mussoorie, which was excellent.

Great service and a typical royal sterling treatment. Staff were cooperative. Food was really good. Breakfast is full of choices. Highly recommended. Only downside is that the hotel is 1 Km from Betalbatim beach. Also, there are no shops nearby at walkable distance.

Loved the stay. The place is very nice, calm and quiet. It's a good place if you want to relax and come back refreshed. The staff were very cooperative and hospitable, I would like to go and spend more time there. And will also refer my friends and other people.

The place is very nice, calm and quite. It's a good place if you want to relax and come back refreshed. The staff were very cooperative and hospitable. The food is also very good and very tasty. There are many activities for everyone and especially for the kids.

Definitely, recommended for a good break from the daily marathon and the service rendered by the whole team is good.

We went there and stayed for 3 days with my friends and cousins. The hotel though a little far from the city of Panaji. We find the same very awesome. The hotel is having a pool which there inmates can use. The food is good but are costly. The reception was also good.

We stayed here for 02 days during our Goa tour. A good hotel located in south Goa only 30 mins from airport. The appearance of hotel is good. On arrival you will be welcomed with drinks. The hospitality is amazing. The rooms were also very nice, spacious and clean with necessary amenities. The resort has pool which is well maintained. The food quality is also excellent, north Indian food available and that too yummy. Another positive point is that you get buses just in front of resort if you want to travel to other parts of Goa. The beach is near to resort. Overall it was a enjoyable stay for us. Recommended for travellers visiting south Goa.

Villagio inn is a sterling holidays resort at Betlabatim village in south Goa. It is quite a good resort which is well maintained by the company. Rooms are very tidy and all the credit goes to the housekeeping team. The bathrooms, bed linen and floors are kept very neat. Room service is excellent with variety of dishes on menu. Swimming pool is extremely well maintained. Food at flavour restaurant is delicious with variety of tastes. Holiday activity team is average. Front office and its ambience is good. I prefer viewers to opt for it. Important thing is do not book cab or taxis in advance for your entire period of stay as there is a drivers union at the resort parking which will not allow other vehicles to be booked in advance which I felt very much annoyed and the resort management had not got anything to solve this problem.

We stayed in Goa for three nights and Monsoon in Goa made our stay worth cherishing. We traveled to Goa from Mumbai by afternoon and took a prepaid taxi to our resort. We checked with him if he could take us around for a short sightseeing trip, but refused as Taxi union at the resort won't allow him to take clients. We have to avail their service compulsory. Alternately you could hire a scooter or a rental car for your travel.

The front desk and housekeeping staff at the resort were prompt and excellent with their service. The food at the restaurant was excellent, especially the breakfast buffet and the dinner. The resort is located in South Goa, a bit remote. The closest Beach was Betalbatim Beaches which was clean and untouched by the crowd. The nearest popular Beach was Colva Beach.

The rooms were well-maintained and clean, including the bathroom. Our room had a balcony overlooking the greenery and the pool. There was swimming pool and indoor games to keep the kids engaged, while you pamper yourself in the in house spa with an Ayurvedic massage. Overall, the monsoon, the pleasant stay and Beaches made our holiday memorable.

Hotel is good. I would recommend keeping an ATM machine within premises as connectivity is not that good to main City. Unless you hire an expensive cab and empty your pocket. Other than that good ambiance, helpful staff, spacious rooms, all good. Nice place to relax.

This is a very good and newest property. Rooms were well maintained. Excellent dining place and the breakfast was beautiful. The nearest beach (Betalbatim) is 10 minutes walk and from there Colva beach is another 20 minutes walk from beach to beach. Staff members are courteous. It is primarily for the members but good for non members as well. This was a value for money.

I was not happy with the hotel. The hotel was not conveniently located. It was located a bit inside. The external appearance of the hotel was good but the internal appearance was not so good. The food was also costly. The staff at the hotel were friendly. The housekeeping service was not good and not up to the mark. The room was not ready when we checked-in. I was not happy with the room allotted and also not happy with the facilities provided. The hotel seemed modern in appearance. The room provided to me was spacious but it was not maintained properly. I was not happy with the services that they had offered to me. The amenities in the room were functioning properly. I won't visit the hotel next time. Hot water facility was provided at the hotel. Both veg and non veg food was served at the hotel. But I preferred only veg food. The food was also not up to the mark. It was expensive in price also. The hotel had provided a tour guide. The activities were not provided by the hotel. The hotel was not value for money. They had not organized any sightseeing trip for me. I would not like to recommend this hotel to other travellers also.

The destination and location of the hotel was convenient to reach Goa was very good. The interior appearance of this hotel was good compared to the exterior. There was no delay in checking procedures and the services of the staff were very good. The rooms in the hotel were very good, spacious with required amenities provided. We were in the sightseeing trip so we did not take food in the hotel. I visited this hotel in the year 2012 and it is an recommendable hotel to other travellers.

The location and appearance of the hotel was very good and services were excellent. The staff members were cooperative and truly professional but we have to ask for the house keeping. The room allotted to me was very good and spacious with mandatory comforts. But the internet and telephone connectivity was a problem. The food provided was good with lots of varieties. They have some activities and they provide sight-seeing trip too. There was no delay during check-in and check-out process and the hotel is worth for the money which I spent.

The resort is convenient to locate and there was no problem faced during travelling here. The staff members in the hotel are helpful and friendly in behaviour. There was no delay in check-in or check-out procedure. The appearance of the hotel is good but some renovation work was going on. The room allotted to me was maintained cleanly with all the required amenities in good condition. The food provided in the hotel was good in quality and taste, and both veg and non-veg varieties were available. There are no activities or games but I managed sightseeing trip by myself. Overall, the hotel is good and as per the tariff the hotel is worth for money spent.

Our purpose to visit Goa is to see all the tourist places, temples and the beautiful beaches. My wife was interested to see the high tides and when the tides were higher than to see hermit crabs to starfish. Some times to relax in resort when it is raining.

Resort have very good swimming pool and fun zone for kids and all guest. Rooms were spacious, comfortable bed and furniture with clean linen. LCD with good cable connection.

Front office staff were very helpful and cordial while check in. Food and beverage service, restaurant staff were always ready to help. Guest can always be comfortable during entire stay. Food is expensive so the guests should be bit careful while ordering food or drinks.

Routine items are supplied by resort team and guests should carry only specific items.

South Goa is where we planned to visit this time. The location and destination were excellent. Goa Villagio is a Sterling Property but the staff is pathetic. Our room was on the third floor and housekeeping was asked to clean it. When we came back after the lunch in the hotel itself, we found that some of our coca cola bottle was missing, we filed a complaint and an action was taken by the owner. Either staff is not paid properly or there is no discipline. However, the issue was resolved. They were at maintenance of swimming pool when we visited, no spa either and we were not informed at the time of booking the same. Other than close proximity to the beach and good food at the hotel, there was nothing to look forward to!

I stayed here on 23rd to 25th May 2015. Resort is very good but location is not very ideal. Resort has swimming pool activities room and restaurant. Restaurant food is good but service is slow. Suggest to hire bikes just outside resorts for. Rs 250 per day. Taxi also available just outside resort charge Rs 2400 per day. Overall, experience is good.

It's best holiday in South Goa, very clean beauty and peaceful resort, nearest a beach for walking distance. Service, location, food are good on affordable price, best activities, I stayed in a resort in Feb 2015 for 2 night. Over all the best deal for relax in troubling life.

The place is totally isolated. It is in a village (Betalbatim). The biggest problem we faced was commutation. I felt, it is very costly compared to other parts of Goa. There is a taxi union run by villagers. Vehicles are allowed to come in the village from other parts of Goa however while going out from the village, one needs to hire villagers vehicle that too with hefty cost. From the resort to Colva which is 2. 7 kms, we were charged Rs. 400 for only drop. For the people who wants to have dinner at Colva or wants to have party at city, they need spend extra from pocket.

Further, self driven vehicles are not available at there. One needs to hire at Madgaon with private number.

Goa is famous for beaches, however Sea shore is 10 min walking distance from the resort through isolated road which is again not comfortable. It was a very lazy holiday I spent at Sterling Villagio Inn. Not recommended to people who want to enjoy beaches with party.

Visited this place recently with my family and had a comfortable stay. Very near to airport and walk able distance to beach. Good food, service and good environment. Must go again and relax for more than a week

Such a lovely place for a getaway. Easy to get into Goa through car, bus, plane and train.

I visited sterling during my honeymoon. It's best hotel in South Goa. Though reception is not that good but rooms are very clean. Food is also good. Swimming pool is also very clean. Room service is very awesome. Twin sharing rooms are very well-managed. Hope to visit Goa and the same hotel.

Being Sterling Holidays member we choose to stay in this hotel for 3 Nights out of our 7 Nights stay in Goa. This property is in laid back, relaxed area of South Goa, which is far away from happening north Goa.

Rooms are spacious, lobby is good. Swimming pool is well maintained. Swashwati (Manager) is very co-operative lady. But the food is average, room service is poor. Bike, car, taxi outside hotel is costly as the hotel people have commission in it and you don't have any option in the area. We hired a car from market, took info from Justdial.

Nearby Beaches are Colva beach and Betalbatim Beach. Colva is a good beach with shacks, water sports, good crowd and action. Betalbatim is a deserted beach but offer good views. Martin's Corner is a good cafe, pub & a eating joint with live music and all near the hotel.

Pool was closed and the room was brilliant, easily 3-4 people can stay. There was a fridge in the room too, LED TV, and the beds were perfect. Staff was amazing and room service is too good. It was Goa so, we used to be all drunk and mess up the room but, once the room service came, Damn, back to square one, clean and perfect! Only problem with the hotel was it was in the City area, 4-5 kms from the beaches, but its manageable as you can hire bikes and cars. And mainly the pool and the games section was under maintenance when I visited, so yeah next time, I have to chill in the pool.

The Resort staff is good. The rooms are neat and clean. The food is also yummy. I feel it is little overpriced but OK because the quality and variety they served. Only problem is local conveyance. I couldn't find taxi near by other then unionised taxi drivers near the resort who were charging heavily, but they were perfect and well aware with all sightseeing, activity places and arrangements. My advice is if anyone can hire taxi on rent ( remember it must be black board with yellow no) would be great.
If any one planning Scuba diving it is at coco beach or Candolim Beach but arrangements have to be made in advance as near 4 hours go in training on day-1 and approx. 06 -07 hours is required on day 2.
Dolphin ride is waste of time. If you want to spend quality time with your soul mate don't forget to go at Palolem Paradise beach in south Goa. Only thing it is furthest (approx. 45 km. )

Though the hotel is good and the service is good. The pool was not working since it was under maintenance and its been a blooper. Else the stay is very pleasant and location is good. Amenities are good and the facilities are ok to keep kids engaged.The staff was pleasant and quick to respond. Rooms were well-maintained. I got a room next to the pool (pool was under maintenance), but good rooms if the pool was available. Easy access to  the pool.

Sterling Hotel was very nice, it is as it appeared in pictures. Service staff were also very nice they were always available. Food was really nice and the juice bar near pool was amazing. Hotel supply all shampoo and other important amenities. It organises many other functions so you would enjoy your stay for sure.

It was our first trip to Goa with our family members. So in way we were prepared for an adventurous outing. The hotel though located in a very calm and upscale locality is a bit difficult to access without a vehicle. Definitely the swimming pool is a great attraction and added fun to our stay. The rooms were well-furnished and neat. The landscape and staff made our stay pleasant.

I visited with my family and stayed in sterling's resort and occupied an apartment. The amenities that were given were simply awesome like discounted spa, tour guide swimming pools etc. The services were good and the activities were amazing like bonfire or games etc. They also provided contacts to rent the bikes for roaming in goa and the travel desk can help us book cab or Volvo coaches to other cities like Mumbai. Travellers are advised to bring swim suits for the beaches and must try the beach sports. Best time is from Oct. to Feb.

This hotel was located in the middle of the market. So the location was okay. Reaching the hotel was not difficult. The services were good enough. The staff at the hotel were helpful, friendly and hygienic. They were quick to attend all my requests. The room allotted to us was very spacious, neat, clean and well-maintained. All the basic amenities like TV, AC and geyser provided in the room were functioning properly. There was a view of the fields from the room. We did not have food from the hotel. There was no problem in check-in or check-out procedure. They had activities like swimming pool, gym, indoor and outdoor games in the hotel. The sightseeing trips were arranged by the hotel.

The hotel was conveniently located. The staff behaviour was fine. The rooms were spacious and fine. The amenities like AC, TV, geyser and everything was there, except refrigerator. I can see the pool view from my room. It was a trip with friends. The food was fine and it was a buffet system. The complimentary breakfast was provided. The amount paid was worth. I would like to recommend this hotel to other travellers. My suggestion is to provide some activities.

The hotel location was good the appearance of the resort was attractive the ambiance was good. The food was also awesome. There was no delay in check-in and check-out. The staff service was good they were quick in responding to our request. The hotel food was tasty and I took veg cuisine, the quality was good. The room was spacious, neat and clean. The amenities were functioning well. I didn't opt for any indoor activities. Overall, the destination was very exciting. I would like to recommend this hotel for other travellers.
Overall and everything was average over there. Appearance was normal. Hotel services were good only. Room was fine and acceptable. Food was okay-okay.

Hotel was very good. Location and appearance were excellent. Interiors and exteriors were nice. Booking and front office staff was good. Staff services were perfect. Check in and check out process was not delayed. Rooms were neat, clean, and spacious. TV, AC, geyser, everything were available and working properly. Swimming pool, gym, everything was there. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and other tourists. Goa is a fantastic place as tourism. I went there with my relatives and it was a relaxing trip.

Hotel was good. Outside and interior look of this hotel was nice. Overall services were satisfactory. Check in and check out facility was not delayed. Swimming pool was available there. I tasted only veg food and it was nice. I booked three rooms there and every room was nicely maintained. It was my family tour for just relaxation in September 2014. Goa as a tourist destination is quite lovely place. Location wise, hotel was good. They provided welcome drink also on my arrival. Pick and drop facility was available but I had not avail this facility.

Hotel was good and also it was conveniently located. Interior and exterior look of the hotel was nice. There was no delay in check in and check out facility. Overall services in the hotel were fine. I booked three rooms in the hotel, rooms was comfortable and clean. I preferred my food from outside the hotel. They did not provide any activity in the hotel. I visited there with my family and friends in March month 2014. It was an adventurous trip. Goa as a destination place is fantastic. They did not serve welcome drink at arrival.

I have been there with my friends. It was for relaxing vacation. They serve food, but we were not able to taste the food. Interior, exterior, furniture painting was satisfactory. The room was clean and well maintained. Their staffs are also very good. The location was convenient to the hotel only one thing this place in South Goa. All basic amenities were working in good condition. There was view from the hotel like Swimming pool and garden. The hotel was value for money. And I would recommend to other travellers. No delay in check in, check out.

The Hotel experience was good. The hotel was conveniently located the hotel was close to Panjim. The hotel appearance of the hotel was good and hygiene both inside and outside. There was no delay in check in and check out. The staff were OK and satisfactory. The service was good. The rooms were quite clean and neat the amenities like TV geyser was well functioning. The was not much view seen through the room as there was pool construction going on. The food was not good, the quality was not up to the mark the varieties of food was limited on the menu it was a buffet system. The destination was good. The ambiance was good. There were activities like both indoor and outdoor was good. Suggestion: There was delay in service, food quality and variety in the food have to be improved.

The hotel was conveniently located I did not face any problem in reaching. The behaviour of the staff was good and friendly. They were quick attentive and the service provided by them was satisfactory. The appearance of the hotel both interior and exterior was average. The room allotted to me was very comfortable and spacious. The room was too clean and well maintained. All the amenities were available and it was working well. The food in the hotel was fine and tasty and even the price was nominal. I did not find any delay in check in and checkout process. They have good swimming pool, gym and some other activities also. The overall stay was very good and comfortable to stay.

Sterling Hotel was one of the beautiful hotel in Karwar. It is located in the super location. Rooms were well furnished and room service was also very good. We have to go ask anything we played indoor games. We also went to island there we did trekking. Overall it was very wonderful experience.

Visited along with my family and by seeing good appearance. Paid the amount and took 2 rooms. Hotel entrance is good having ample of vehicle parking. Room service is good and food is excellent. Hotel helped in explaining details of local siteseeings. Front office response is excellent.

The location was close to the beach and a location very difficult to find. The hotel appearance was normal. The room was booked and there was no problem in booking. The hotel staff were good and the service was very normal. I had been here in the month of July 2014 with my friends as a relaxing trip. The room was neat and clean and had basic facilities. An activity like swimming pool, games and gym were available. It is recommendable to others.

The hotel I stayed was good. It was easy and convenient to travel. I had been with my family. The ambience of the hotel was excellent, pretty much attractive. The service was very good. The staffs were also helpful and professional. The room allotted was spacious and well maintained with required amenities. The food provided was a bit expensive, but really good in taste and quality. It was very nice experience at this hotel and recommendable to other travelers as well.

Overall, my stay was very comfortable there. They were having a private beach and very peace and calm environment. Appearance was very nice. I visited there with my family in July, 2014. AC and small balcony was there in the room with beautiful view. It was a very quiet and relax place. Room was very comfortable. Food was very-very good. All varieties were available there. Buffet system was available there. South Indian dishes were very good. Indoor game and swimming pool were also there. It was worth staying there.

There was no difficulty in locating the hotel  with good appearance, where as the staff services was good as well as well maintained, spacious rooms along the functioning amenities but there was no view as well as clean laundry service. The food was good whereas there was no activities and there was on time  during check-in and check-out.

I travelled there in August 2014 with friends for vacation. Location of the hotel was very good. Appearance of the hotel was also very good. Booking and front office facility was good. There was no delay in check in and check out. Staff service was very good. They were friendly and very helpful. Room was very clean. It was very compact. It was fully furnished. TV, AC, or everything was provided in the room. Overall, room was excellent. Food facility was there but I did not take my food there. I did not know about activities. Chennai as a tourist place is good but the beach there was excellent.

Had been to Villaggio in 2nd week of May. Stayed for 4 days. The resort is very good. We took room facing swimming pool, room was very spacious and clean. Overall experience is good. Service was very good and the pool was clean. One negative thing is food is too expensive, for one time you have to spend nearly 5000/- for a family of 4 which is exorbitant. Parking is not enough for the resort.

When I traveled for Goa then I stayed in this hotel. I reached the hotel by own transportation. Location was fabulous. Inner and outer look of the hotel was good. I had done booked my room online. Booking and front office was cooperative and helpful. Services were quick. Food was average. Activities were up to the mark. Goa place is excellent for travel. I traveled with a group in April month. It was a romantic holiday. I can recommend this hotel for travelers.

I reached by flight from Bangalore to Goa and from there by taxi. It was located near to Calangute Beach. Location of the hotel was good and it was very near to all the beaches. Food and drink was very good. I am pure vegetarian so I tried only veg food there. Quality and variety wise, it was good. Look wise, it was good. Booking was done through phone. Booking and front office facility was good. Hotel's staff service was very good. Room was good. There was not much activity so it was below average. As a tourist place, Goa is excellent. I visited there in August 2013 with couple. It was a romantic trip. It is an excellent place so we enjoyed a lot there. Food wise and cleanliness wise, Goa is better compared to other hotels.

It was an average hotel and it was an official trip. It was in the month of February 2014 and it was a tour package. I stayed there for 2 nights and it was a family trip. There were no activities available and the food was provided, but it was very costly. The hotel was located near to the bus stand it is just half a km. The room was not so bad and there was some delay in check-in and check-out. The appearance of the hotel was good.

Resort was located very near to the beach. Billing process of the resort was timely. Location of the resort was very good and easy. Outside and inside look of the resort was fine. Reception people were well spoken and cooperative. Staff was good in behavior and helpful. Services were satisfactory. Room was well furnished and spacious. I had non-veg food there it was delicious with different qualities and varieties. Activities were arranged by the resort it was fine. Goa as a tourist destination is peaceful and lovely place for travelers. I visited this place with my friend in August month.

When I travelled at Wayanad then I stayed at Win Flower Hotel. Location and appearance were fine. Rooms were very clean and very spacious. TV and other basic facilities were available in the room. Food was excellent. Both veg and non-veg dishes were served in the hotel. Services were fast. Reception staff was helpful and friendly. Booking and front office staff was perfect.  Check in and check out timing was proper. I had no problem to stay in this hotel. There was no outdoor activity available. Wayanad is a fabulous place as tourist destination.

When I travelled to Goa, I stayed at this resort. It was located at about five to ten minutes walking distance from Colva Beach. Location was best and the interior was creatively decorated. I faced some problem during check-in and check-out timing. Rooms were neat and spacious. Food was available but I took my meal outside the hotel. Services were quick and sensible and they provided many activities in the hotel but I did not use. Goa is a beautiful place as tourist destination. I went there with my friends in the month of June. It was a relaxation trip.

It was a good stay for me. Hotel was very near to the beach. Swimming pool was there. Both veg. and non-veg. food was available there. I was happy with it. I am a member of this hotel. Staff behavior was okay. Services were on time. Activities like snooker, carom, etc. were provided by them. I travelled there in January 2014 along with my family. It was a relax type of holiday. It is value for our money. It is a recommendable hotel to others. Hotel's location was very good. Appearance wise, it was also very good. Booking and front office facility was good. Staff service was also good. Room was very good. Food facility was also very good. Activity part was good. Goa is an excellent place as a tourist destination.
We had a nice stay and had a nice time on the pool. Appearance was good and we had fun at the resort. It was far from the beaches. You need to hire a bike to roam around the place.

Resort's facility was not very good. The first thing about the hotel was its rooms were not clean and the other thing was that if you ask for something it takes much longer than you expect and sometime if you ask for something they never get back to us. Otherwise, we used to go to the resort just for sleep at night. Room was below average.  It was an AC room. Hot water,geyser and all amenities were available in the rooms. View was not visible properly from there. Room service was average because they used to take much longer time and for one thing we had to call two or three times. We did not take our meal inside the hotel. Location wise,it was very good. It was around four to five km away from the prime location. Look wise,hotel's ambiance was average. Booking,front office and reception services were good. Services of the hotel were bad. Lot of activity was there but we did not have more time to do it ,because we were outside most of the time.
